loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a wife of A. D. and lives in the Pakistani city of Multan, famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She owns a small, two-roomed house where she has lived with her family for the past ten years.
A very talented lady, Shahnaz operates a sewing business from her house. She sews clothes for neighbors and charges them between 100 and 150 PKR for each dress. She can sew two dresses per day. In this way, she can earn between 200 and 300 PKR maximum per day. Her earnings enable her to pay for the utilities.
Shahnaz's husband has a timber sales shop in the nearby market where he sells timber to customers. He has been doing this work for over six years. Both husband and wife are very hardworking. Most of all, they love their work and do it happily. They handle their finances confidently and bravely by helping each other from their businesses.
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With this loan, he will buy timber in bulk, which will enable him to increase his sales by selling timber to more customers.

loans.use: To purchase timber in bulk

loans.name: Maria Maricela

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Maricela M. J. cuenta con un salón de belleza, tiene mas de 5 años de experiencia en dicha actividad, lo que le permite tener muy buena clientela,  su negocio opera bajo el nombre de SALA DE BELLEZA MARICELA, el cual esta ubicado en el Barrio San isidro, lugar estratégico para este tipo de negocio ya que esta ubicado en el centro de la cuidad de El Paraíso y es de fácil acceso.     
La Sra. M. es conocida en el lugar por su solvencia moral y de buena conducta.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de material y accesorios de belleza como ser Shampoo, cremas, tintes, gotas de tratamiento etc. 
Con los ingresos que le a generado su negocio a logrado sacar adelante su familia. 
Maria por su profesionalismo y calidad en el servicio que presta sus clientes le prefieren lo que le permite tener clientes todo el año, generándole ingresos con los que apoya a su esposo, lo que les facilita sobre llevar las cargas mutuamente y así salir adelante juntos.
texts.en:
Maria Maricela M. J. has a beauty salon. She has 5 years of experience in this line of work, and as a result she has a very good customer base. Her business operates under the name "Sala de Belleza Maricela," and is located in the San Isidro neighborhood, a strategic location for this type of business since it is located in the center of the city of El Paraiso and so offers easy access. Senora M. is known in the area for her moral character and her good conduct. She will use the loan to buy accessories and beauty supplies such as shampoo, creams, hair dyes, hair treatment drops, etc. With the income she generates from her business she has managed to provide for her family. As a result of Maria's professionalism and the quality of service that she provides to her customers, her customers prefer her business and her business is always busy. As a result, she generates income to help her husband, making it easier on them as they can bear the burdens together and get ahead together.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioners, hair dyes, peroxides, hair treatments, hair gel, hair creams, hair treatment vials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn G., 56, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Angelito G., a string instrument maker, and is the mother of a daughter currently taking a nursing course in college. By the grace of God, Evelyn has managed to support her child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to support her child until she finishes college. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Evelyn. As she has been a college graduate herself, she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.
Evelyn operates a string instrument business. She mostly supports her husband, Angel, who is the one who makes the string instruments by hand. Together, they manage to produce high quality instruments such as violins, cellos, guitars and others. Angel has also managed to invent a few things he currently uses to make his instruments – one of them is a violin clamp that he is planning to patent. They are going to start trying to export soon, as there are very few customers who buy their products in their immediate vicinity.
To help her continue to operate her business, Evelyn is requesting a loan of 28,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy supplies for her instrument business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Evelyn dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her instrument business

loans.name: Wendy Aracely

texts.es:
la sra. Wendy Aracely Morazán Z. cuenta con una pequeña pulpería denominada Pulp. GABY donde vende a su clientes productos de la canasta básica de consumo familiar,  actividad que tiene poco tiempo de realizarla.
el credito lo necesita para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio, las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia, de esta manera colabora a su esposo y así juntos salen adelante,  ya que son padres de dos hijos uno de los cuales esta en la preparatoria.
nos comento que se sienten muy contentos.
texts.en:
Wendy Aracely Morazán Z. has a small grocery store called "Pulp. Gaby" where she sells basic necessities to her customers, a business she has had for a short time. She needs the loan to buy more merchandise and in this way stock her store. She needs the earnings to provide for her family, in this way she works together with her husband so that they can get ahead, since they are the parents of 2 children, one of whom is in high school. She tells us that they feel very content.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, toilet paper, soft drinks, milk, butter, cooking oil, sweets, churros, salt, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en: Miss Sokhen C., age 36, is single and lives with her sister and elderly mother in a village along national road number four about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sokhen has been selling groceries for three years, buying grocery items from Phnom Penh market and then reselling them from her home. She is applying for a loan of $700 in order to stock up on grocery items for reselling.  She will also use part of her loan to build a restroom for her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for reselling.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle S. is from the town of Talibon. She is 20 years old and married with two infant children. To make a living, Michelle gathers and sells seaweed in the market. Michelle has been in this business for over 3 years.  Michelle recently joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first CEVI loan, in the amount of 5000 PHP, in order to buy nets and other equipment for gathering seaweed.

loans.use: To buy nets and other equipment for gathering seaweed.

loans.name: Liv

texts.en: Mrs. Liv D., age 53, is a widow with one married daughter who also lives in the family home. They live in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Liv has been selling fish for five years. She buys fish from the market, approximately 5 kilometers from her house, and resells it in her village. She is requesting her first loan, in the amount of $600, to purchase a motorbike for transporting fish.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transporting fish.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma B., age 47, and her husband Nicomedes, work hard to cover their daily expenses and pay for the education of their two children, one who is in elementary school and the other who attends college.  For the past six years Wilma has been direct selling branded apparels, cosmetics, footwear, and accessories, as well as operating an Internet cafe.  Wilma would like to keep her business current and hopes to buy more products for direct selling, one new computer, and to pay for maintenance on existing computers.  For this purpose she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan.  Wilma has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since 2008 and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.  She hopes that the loan will help to grow her business and continue to provide for the education of her daughter and son. 

About the Center for Community Transformation (CCT):
CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missionary work in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.  Locally, all CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products for direct selling.

loans.name: Socheata

texts.en: Mrs. Socheata M. is 32 years old and her husband, Mr. Phan Phann, is 40 years old.  They have been married since 1997 and have one son and one daughter who both attend school. Their family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Socheata M. sells fruit (mango, longan, and bananas). Her husband is a chef who cooks for weddings and other ceremonies. Socheata wants to expand her business, so she is requesting her first loan in the amount of $600 to purchase additional fruit for selling.

loans.use: To purchase mango, longan, and banana for selling.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria V., 34, and her husband Reynaldo have four children, three in elementary school and one in high school. Maria works hard to cover her daily expenses and the cost of the children's education. She owns a broom-making shop that she has been running for three years, earning PHP 6,800 a month for her family.

Maria, who has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation since 2007 and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings, is seeking a PHP 8,000 loan to purchase additional raw materials for her store, including bamboo and wire. She hopes that in the long run access to capital will allow her broom business to expand and produce more income for her and her family.

About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missionary work in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

Locally, all CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Composed of 15 to 30 community partners, the fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Raw materials for broom manufacturing

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina T., from the town of Talibon, is 46 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rufina owns and operates a business gathering seaweed and selling it at the market. She hopes to achieve a stable income in order to sustain her children's education.

Rufina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase equipment for gathering seaweed, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for gathering seaweed

loans.name: Yum

texts.en:
Mrs. Yum S., 43 years old and her husband, Mr. Tres Ter, 44 years old, have been married since 1983 and have seven children. They live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Yum's family is Cham Muslim, an ethnic minority in Cambodia. Their main source of income is from their fishing business, as Yum and her husband fish from the river and lake near their house and sell to the market. Some of her fishing materials break so she is requesting a loan of US$1,200 to make the repairs and buy more fishing nets for the business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and repair fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Tey

texts.en: Tey V. is a woman living on a low income in the best territory of Phnom Penh, where the location is good for business. To make a living, Tey V. sells incense and candles that she either produces or buys from her supplier. She transports her items to sell in and around the markets. Her husband helps provide income by working in the construction sector. They work hard to ensure their two children have enough food and are educated. Tey V. owns some land in good place for growing, and she wishes to raise crops for selling to generate extra revenue for the family. Because she lacks the capital to make that possible, Tey V. has applied for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizer and seeds for growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for growing.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthy L. and her husband, Mr. Thol Pich, have been married since 1996 and have one son and one daughter who both attend school. They live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  Chanthy and her husband are farmers. They grow corn, bitter gourd, and green beans on their farmland in the village. The couple requests now their second Kiva loan to continue increasing their productivity. The loan of $500 will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain their farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Bricelda

texts.en: Bricelda G. is from the town of Talibon. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children ages seven and three. To make a living, Bricelda collects seaweed and sells it in the market. Bricelda has been engaged in seaweed farming for over 2 years now. She also recently started making and selling food items, and she would like to purchase more ingredients for making food. Bricelda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bricelda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and now requests her second loan, for 6000 PHP, to further grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for making food to sell.

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es:
el sr. Panfilo M. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña pulpería que opera bajo el nombre de pulperia Pancho, en donde ofrece a su clientela productos de la canasta básica familiar y también productos e insumos agrícolas, tiene mas de 6 años de venir realizando dicha actividad económica.
Panfilo nos comento que vende poco ya que por los momentos el comercio y las ventas han bajado pero que ya viene la cosecha de frijoles, maíz y después la de café y espera estar preparado para la venta de productos a su esmerada clientela, se siente muy satisfecho con su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Panfilo M. is a merchant. He has a small general store called Pancho where he offers his customers common groceries and also farming products and tools. He has been doing this for over 6 years. Panfilo told us that he is still selling only a little right now, since at the moment sales have gone down. However, the bean and corn harvest is coming up, and then the coffee harvest, and he hopes to be ready to sell the best products to his customers. He is very satisfied with his business. This loan will be used for the purchase of more merchandise to stock his business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of oil, butter, beans, rice, sugar, bread, biscuits, coffee, drinks, ham, toilet paper, soaps, batteries, candles, matches

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny K. and her husband, Mr. Sophal Un, live along national road number one about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1994 and have two daughters who are in school. In the past, Ny stayed at home but she is now a garment factory worker. Her husband has been a mason since 1995 who works in the village and a near-by province. She does not have transportation for commuting to work, so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Geltrodis

texts.en:
Geltrodis A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 47 years old and married with five children. She raises pigs for fattening and sale. She also manages a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products. Her husband is a seaweed farmer and she sometimes helps selling seaweed in the market. Geltrodis works hard to provide for her family and improve their living conditions.

Geltrodis joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros V. is a widow with one son who has full-time employment. She lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Ros is a farmer who also raises ducks at home. She buys baby ducklings and raises them until they grow big enough to lay eggs. She sells the duck eggs in Phnom Penh City. Ros wants to expand her business, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional ducks to raise.

loans.use: To use for raising duck.

loans.name: Nelson Javier

texts.es:
el sr. Nelson Javier M. L. se dedica a la caficultura y la ganaderia, actividad que tiene varios años de venir realizando y a través del esfuerzo a ido creciendo poco a poco, sus propiedades se ubican en la zona de San José Mata de Guineo este lugar es montañoso y de clima fresco que presentan las condiciones favorables para el cultivo de café y en las Mieles zona de Las Trojes lugar apto para la ganadería donde tiene ganado de producción de Leche y de engorde para el destazo.
con los ingresos que le genera esta actividad satisface las necesidades familiares y otras obligaciones 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de insumos para la produccion de cafe, luego el café seco en pergamino  lo vende en Nicaragua ya que tiene un mejor precio en esa zona.
texts.en:
Nelson Javier M. L. makes a living growing coffee and raising cattle. He's been doing this for a number of years and has grown little by little through his hard work. He has land in the San Jose Mata de Guineo area which is a cool mountainous area with favorable conditions for growing coffee. He also has land in Las Mieles in the area of Las Trojes which is suited for cattle. Here he raises dairy cattle as well as beef cattle. He uses the income from these activities to meet his family obligations and a few others as well. He will use the loan to purchase various items for coffee production which he sells in Nicaragua once it is dried since he gets a better price there.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items for coffee production

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Mrs. C. is 26 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for more than six years. She gets fish from her fisherman husband or buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She is married to Run Sok, 30, pictured here. The family has difficulty traveling anywhere because they have no vehicle, so Mrs. C. has applied for a loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle to provide transportation for the family. With any remaining money from the loan, she will buy additional fishing equipment for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle to provide transportation for family.

loans.name: Martha Lizeth

texts.es:
la sra. Martha Lizeth A. D. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta de ropa, calzado y cosméticos, dicha actividad tiene mas de 2 años de realizarla, tiene muy buena clientela por sus precios y calidad en el producto,  su negocio es conocido como BOUTIQUE MARTHA y esta ubicado en el Barrio Las Flores, este lugar es estratégico para este tipo de negocio, ya que esta ubicado en el centro de la cuidad de El Paraíso y es de fácil acceso para muchas pesonas.
Durante todo este tiempo nos comento que le a ido muy bien, gracias a los ingresos económicos que percibe le a permitido seguir preparándose académicamente,  a su vez trabaja como maestra de educación primaria en la Escuela Sagrado Corazón de la ciudad de El Paraíso en la jornada diurna, su negocio lo atiende por las tardes, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería como ser pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, sandalias y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Martha Lizeth A. D. has a small store where she sell clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She has had it for 2 yeas and has developed a good customer base due to good quality and price. Her business in called Boutique Martha and is in the Barrio las Flores neighborhood. This is a strategic location since it is in the center of the city of El Paraiso and is of easy access for many people. She tells us that things have gone well and the income has allowed her to continue her studies. She also works as a primary school teacher in the Sagrado Corazon school in El Paraiso in the mornings. In the afternoon she works at her business. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, sandals and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pants, skirts, lotions, shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou C., 25, is married with one young child living at home in the Takeo province. She is a garment worker, typically making US$3 each day and her husband is a motorbike mechanic. Her husband typically makes about US$4 each day. She would like a loan of US$800 to purchase tools for her husband to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is the wife of Z. I. and resides in Multan, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She owns a small house with two rooms where she has lived with her family for the past 10 years. She is 35 years old and works in a factory on a monthly wage. She is a very caring lady who manages her household chores before going to work. Shahnaz works to pay off the educational expenses of her five children. She has three sons and two daughters. Her elder son runs a food stall in the market selling samosas which are very famous among the people. The others are enrolled in a local school and are in 4th, 2nd and kindergarten respectively.

Her husband is involved in a dairy business. He has a buffalo at home from which he gets about 8-10 kgs of milk. He sells 1 kg of milk for 45 PKRs and earns on 10kg milk approximately 450 PKRs which helps him to cover the expenses of the family.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy another buffalo and increase the productivity of milk. She is hopeful that this investment will bring a positive change in her husband’s business and that he will be able to earn a good income and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for a dairy business

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
la sra. Adela Martínez se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña repostería denominada REPOSTERIA B&D la que ha llenado de sabor por mas de 10 años al pueblo paraiseño, su sabor y precio hacen de su negocio tener muy buena clientela,  su negocio esta ubicado en el Barrio Las Flores frente al Mercado Municipal de La ciudad de El Paraíso, Adela a sabido ganarse su clientela con la calidad de producto y el buen precio que maneja en su negocio     
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materia prima para la fabricacion del pan, necesita producir lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Adela Martínez is a businesswoman who has a small bakery named Repostería B&D which for more than ten years has filled the El Paraíso community with flavor. Her business has a very good customer base owing to its tasty offerings and prices, and is located in the Las Flores neighborhood across from the City Market of the city El Paraíso. Adela has known how to win her customers over with product quality and the good prices she offers in her business. She will use the loan to purchase basic ingredients for making the pastries of which she must produce enough to satisfy customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, lard, margarine, flavorings, sugar, colorings, eggs and milk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oum

texts.en: Oum P., 34, is married with one child who lives at home in the Takeo province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US$3.30 a day. Her husband is employed at a private company and makes about US$6 a day. Oum P. would like a loan of US$1200 to purchase a motorbike to transport grocery products.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun N., 48, is married and lives with four of her children in Takeo province. She and her husband work together making cow roofs, typically earning about $3.30 US each day and they are also supported by one child working in a garment factory. The family spends about $45 US on food, $5 US on utilities, $40 US on transportation and $40 US on other expenses. Since the family spends so much on transportation, Hun N. is asking for a loan of $1000 US to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben C., 54, is married and lives with five of her children in Takeo province. She and her husband are silk weavers typically making about US$2 each day and are supported by one child working in the garment factory.

This family spends about US$35 on food, US$2 on utilities, US$15 on their children’s education, US$10 on transportation and US$20 on other expense. Ben C. would like to take a loan of US$800 to purchase more silk for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase more silk for her weaving business

loans.name: Hajran's Group

texts.en:
Hajran is 39 years old and is married with a son. She lives in a city in Pakistan called Multan, famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She owns a small house of two rooms where she has been living with her family for over ten years.

Hajran’s son’s name is Majid Ali and he is thirteen years old and is studying in 8th standard. She wants to provide him with a good education and that’s why she works hard by operating her sewing business. She is very good at her art and gets regular orders from her neighbors and relatives as well.

Hajran’s husband’s name is M. A. and he runs a grocery shop in the nearby market. His shop is the busiest one in the marketplace and his customers respect him for his good behavior. He never compromises on the quality of his goods and this is one of the reasons that people come to him to buy their groceries. He has been in this business for the past four years.

Hajran has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will put more groceries in his grocery shop and increase his clientele base by fulfilling their requirements. This is Hajran’s 2nd loan and she has been found to be a responsible loan user with her previous loan. She never missed any meetings and paid her installments on time.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Kol S. is 34 years old and is a resident of Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She currently contributes to the family's food needs by working in the garment industry. She is married and has six children, four of whom are single and live in the family home.

To help support the family's living conditions, three of her single children are employed. Her husband used to work as a taxi driver but currently he works as a fisherman.

The family's living conditions are not so good because their house is often breaking down. Therefore, Kol S. would like to ask for a loan in order to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Logn

texts.en:
Logn S., 31, is married and lives with her two children in Takeo province. She is a professional silk weaver, making approximately US$2.50 each day. Her husband, pictured here, is a motorbike mechanic and the family is also supported by his US$2 income each day.

Logn S. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase both silk and mechanic’s tools.

loans.use: To purchase silk for her weaving business and mechanic's tools for her husband's business

loans.name: Sroun

texts.en:
Sroun S., 31, is married and lives with her three children in Takeo province. She is a professional silk weaver, making approximately US$2 each day. Her husband buys and sells cows and the family is also supported by his US$5 income each day.

Sroun S. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 for her husband to use to buy and sell more cows.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy and sell more cows

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor O., 63, is married and lives with three of her children in Takeo province. Working a farm together with her husband, Sor O. typically makes US$1.50 each day. Her family is also supported by two of the children who work in garment factories and one child who is a professional silk weaver.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sor O. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of U.S. $1,200 to purchase more raw silk for weaving. (Sor O. and her husband were not available for picture so her daughter, whose work is weaving silk, is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay S., 35, is a professional silk weaver, making U.S. $2.50 each day in Takeo province. She is married and has four children living at home who require support. Her husband, Phorn Tit, makes approximately U.S. $3 every day by making incense. Lay S. would like a loan of U.S. $1,200 to purchase more raw silk for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Shamim A. is a wife of M. I. and resides in a city called Multan, famous for its shrines and sweetmeats in Pakistan.  She is 47 years old and the mother of five children, four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son runs a CD center in the market. Her next two children are involved in vegetable selling business. The youngest of them has no work and doesn’t do anything. Her daughter is involved in a sewing business. They all contribute some of their earnings to financially support their family.

Shamim herself is involved in an embroidery business. She is good at her art, and crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes to give them a new and good look. She has a contract with different boutiques and by fulfilling their orders she earns a good income of approximately 5,000 PKRs every month which is a big support to her family.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her eldest son who has been running his CD center for the past five years. He sells movies and films, music, and games CDs as well. He has a good clientele base in the market. With the loan, he plans to stock more CDs desired by his customers and hopes increase his earnings.  Shamim is hopeful that this investment will enable her son to enhance his business and increase his income.   This is Shamim's second loan from Asasah, and during her first loan cycle, she never missed any meetings and paid all her installments on time.

loans.use: Purchase movies, music, and game CDs for resale.

loans.name: Nuevo Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
el grupo el nuevo esfuerzo esta integrado por 3 personas que se conocen desde hace muchos años atras, Los señores son personas que tienen sus propios negocios, cada uno tiene amplia experiencia en la administración de su negocio, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
 
el sr. Juan Antonio C. se dedica a la molienda de maíz,  cuenta con un molino de su propiedad, ubicado en su casa de habitación, con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio comenzó un proyecto de ampliación de su casa pero se quedo sin el capital suficiente para terminarlo y aun le falta colocar el techo, motivo por el cual esta solicitando el credito.

Cabe mencionar que sus condiciones de vida han mejorado notablemente. 
Juan es casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de tortillas, negocio que tiene una clientela muy grande y además cuenta con la ventaja de que no tiene que movilizarse a moler el maíz, juntos colaboran con los gastos de la casa. 

el sr. Elias Antonio M. se dedica a la molienda de maíz, cuenta con un molino de su propiedad, ubicado en su casa de habitación negocio en el que tiene (9) años de experiencia en la administración del mismo.
Además su esposa colabora con los gastos de la casa ya que ella labora en una fábrica de tabacos de esta ciudad de Danlí.
Don Elías, concibió junto a su esposa 4 hijos de los cuales tres dependen del matrimonio a los cuales les brindan todos los gastos: alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación.  
En la actualidad el sr. Murillo no cuenta con el capital suficiente para equipar mejor su molino por lo que esta solicitando el credito para la reparacion del mismo.

el sr. Esteban S. L. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con diez años de haber iniciado su negocio, la venta de helados en su bicicleta,  en la que recorre la mayor parte de esta ciudad, sus condiciones de vida han mejorado notablemente.
Don Esteban es una persona de 63 años de edad pero con un espíritu y animo fuerte de trabajar y seguir adelante, esta casado con la Sra. Julia Zuniga con quien concibieron 13 hijos de los cuales 12 están vivos y solo uno depende de ellos, al cual le cubren a un 100% los gastos actualmente esta cursando sus estudios secundarios, los otros hijos ya están casados y han formado sus propias familias.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Esfuerzo (New Effort) group is made up of three persons who have known each other for many years. The men each have their own business along with ample experience in running their business. The details are as follows: Juan Antonio C. is a miller who grinds corn. He has his own mill located in his home. With the profits from his business he initiated an expansion of his living quarters but ended up without enough capital to finish the project. He is seeking the loan so that he may go ahead and install the roof. It bears mentioning that his lifestyle has improved considerably. Juan is married and his wife makes a living selling tortillas to a very large number of customers, an advantageous business given that she does not have to go anywhere to grind the corn. Together they handle household expenses. Elias Antonio M. makes a living as a miller of corn and has his own mill located in his home. He has nine years of experience running his business. In addition his wife helps with household expenses since she works in a tobacco product factory in this city of Danlí. Elías and his wife conceived four children of whom three are dependent on the couple to provide for all their needs: food, clothing, medical and educational. Currently Mr. M. does not have sufficient capital to better equip and repair his mill which is why he is seeking this loan. Esteban S. L. is a businessman who for ten years has sold icecream from his bicycle which he uses to traverse the greater part of the city. His lifestyle has improved considerably. Estaban is a gentleman who is 63 years of age but with a strong spirit and will to work and keep moving forward. He is married to Julia Zuniga with whom he conceived thirteen children of which twelve are living. Only one child who is currently in middle school is dependent on them and they pay 100% of his expenses; the other children have married and formed their own families.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials, spare parts for a mill, icecream and cones

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is 30 years old and married with one son, resideding in a city called Multan, a Pakistani city famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She owns a small two-room house and has been living in it with her family for over eight years.

A very caring lady, Allah Rakhi carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and a mother efficiently. She gets up early in the morning, cleans the house and prepares breakfast for her family. She is an uneducated lady but she wants her son to get a good education and make his parents proud. Her son reads in the 2nd standard.

Her husband's name is A. H. and works driving a rickshaw in local areas. The earnings from his work have enabled him to help pay for his son's admittance to school. Nowadays he is faces issues with his rickshaw as its engine is creating problems and releasing bad sounds, which may get him into big trouble if he fails to repair it before more serious problems arise. 

Therefore, Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from Asasah for to get the money to repair her husband’s rickshaw. This loan is Allah Rakhi's second from Asasah.  During her first loan cycle, she was found to be responsible, never missed any meetings, and paid all her installments on time.

loans.use: Repair a rickshaw used for transportation services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a trailer to transport salt.

loans.name: Soth's Group

texts.en:
Soth L., 55, is a village bank president of this nine member loan.  They live in Tuol Kdei village, Kandal province. The members of this group will use the loan to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their businesses.

Soth and her husband are farmers who own a 1.50-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice and peanuts for a living.  Aside from farming, they also fish.  In order to support her fishing business, Soth will use her portion of the loan to buy nets and fishing supplies.  They are able to earn a small income to support their famiL..  Soth and her husband have three children.  Two are seamstresses in the garment factory and one attends school.

loans.use: Buy fishnets and fishing supplies for fishing.

loans.name: Seutatia

texts.en:
Seutatia L. is 29 and married with four children. She plants and harvests taamu (a large root vegetable like taro) for sale. Seutatia has three years of experience in this business. 

Seutatia needs a loan of 1,500 Samoan talas to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or about $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Seutatia joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Seutatia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the wife of M. A. and she resides in a city called Multan, which is famous for its shrines and sweetmeats, in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms there and has been living in it with her family for over 30 years.
 
A 40-year-old lady with a happy nature, Nasreen stays at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and a mother very well. She has given birth to three daughters. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school and read in 5th, 4th and 2nd standards respectively.
 
Nasreen’s husband is involved in a dairy business. He has a buffalo at his home from which he gets milk and sells it to different milk shops. He has been doing this work for over 10 years. With this business, he has been able to enroll his daughters into school.
 
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, he will buy another buffalo and increase the milk production of his business.
 
Nasreen is hopeful that this investment will bring a positive change to her husband’s business and her family will be able to live in a far better position. This is the first time she has applied for a loan from any microfinance institution (MFI) and she wants to build a long-term relationship with Asasah.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for the dairy business

loans.name: Sopo

texts.en:
Sopo I. is 32 and married with one child.  She plants and harvests taro for sale. Sopo has a year of experience in this business.  

Sopo needs a loan of 1,000 Samoan talas to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or about $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Sopo joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sopo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Ati

texts.en:
Ati F. is 52 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  She has 5 years of experience in this business.  

In 2005, Ati joined SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Ati's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  She has had 4 previous loans with this organization, and is asking for a new loan of WST 2,000 to purchase a new sewing machine.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala A. is 43 and married with 7 children.  She owns a business venture planting, harvesting and selling taamu.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  

In 2009, Kalala joined SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Kalala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  She has had 1 previous loan with this organization, and is asking for a new loan of WST 1,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en:
Mouena C. is 24 and engaged with 1 child.  She owns a business venture planting, harvesting and selling fruits & vegetables.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.  

In 2008, Mouena joined SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Mouena's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  She has had 2 previous loans with this organization, and is asking for a new loan of WST 2,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand her business.

About  SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Dinora Jeaqueline

texts.es:
la sra. Dinora Jeaqueline C. N. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene 4 años de haber iniciado con una pulpería misma que opera bajo el nombre Pulpería “DANIA”.
El crecimiento en su negocio es notable.
tambien la Sra. C. tiene otro negocio de pulpería ubicado en la Colonia el Encanto en la ciudad de Danlí y es administrado por una hermana.
Doña Dinora es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen en su totalidad de ella, cubriendo los gastos de alimentación, vivienda, salud, vestuario y educación, en la actualidad ambos hijos están cursando sus estudios primarios. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Dinora Jeaqueline C. N. sells popular consumer products. Four years ago, she started her own octopus meat shop called "DANIA". The growth of this business has been notable. Mrs C. also has another octopus meat shop, run by one of her sisters, in the Colonia el Encanto neighbourhood of Danlí. Dinora is a single mother, with two children that depend on her entirely for their food, accommodation, health, clothing and education. Both children are currently in primary education. The loan will be used to buy produce and promote her business more.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy produce for her shop (including soft drinks, fruit juice, butter, oil, soaps, beans, rice, bread, sugar, biscuits, donuts (churros), salt, bagged water, batteries, candles, soups, sauces, cakes, and deodorants)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jesus Gustavo

texts.es:
el sr. Jesus Gustavo E. A. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual viene comenzando y tiene 5 y medio años de dedicarse a la carpintería,  es notable el crecimiento en su negocio de carpinteria porque monto una pulperia la cual la atiende la esposa.

Es notable que sus condiciones de vida han mejorado aparte del crecimiento de su negocio a hecho mejoras en su casa de habitación.
Don Gustavo E. tiene tres hijos los cuales dependen en su totalidad de el, dos de ellos actualmente cursan educación secundaria y uno cursa educación primaria. 
el credito lo utilizara para surtir su nuevo negocio y siempre él dedicarse a la carpintería.
tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante con su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús Gustavo E. A. is a merchant. He has recently opened a small grocery store. He has also been a carpenter for five and a half years. His carpentry business has grown notably for it allowed him to set up the grocery store that his wife tends to. It’s also noticeable that his living conditions have improved in addition to his business’ growth for he has made some home improvements, too. Mr. Gustavo E. has three children who depend on him 100%. Two are currently in secondary school and one is in elementary school. He will use the loan to stock his new business and he will always continue in carpentry. He has many desires to get ahead with his family and provide them with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy powdered milk, juices, beverages, soaps, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, batteries, pills, candles, matches, rice, sugar, beans, tortillas, bread, cookies, churros (dough formed into sticks or rings and fried in oil).

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion C. has successfully repaid her first Kiva loan! With the loan she financed and sustained her handicraft business, which has been in increasing demand. She is so thankful for your support and the opportunity to borrow money from Kiva. She is very happy that, with the loan, she has been able to provide satisfactory services without delay to her regular customers. She now wishes to access a larger loan to expand her handicraft business and earn more profits. Encarnacion thanks Kiva for providing her with the opportunity to increase her income. Your support is important to her family and they are very grateful.

Encarnacion joined Kiva partner ASHI to follow her dream of providing her family with a decent life. Prior to joining ASHI, Encarnacion had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams, but she got her first loan from ASHI and started her own business weaving sleeping mats using panan (a kind of palm) leaf. As she continued to get loans from ASHI and save some of her profits, she was able to grow her business. Now she makes other kinds of handicrafts, such as native bags from abaka (banana leaf) fiber, hats, placemats made from twigs, and other home decorations. Many souvenir shop owners visit Encarnacion's village to purchase her products. Other customers are tourists and Overseas Filipino Workers (OFW) wanting to buy presents for their colleagues abroad. Encarnacion has noticed that her monthly income has almost doubled since receiving her first loan, because she has attracted new customers with her additional inventory. 

Now she is seeking another Kiva loan of 28,000 PHP to maintain her business and purchase more of the raw materials needed for her handicrafts. With the support of ASHI and her Kiva partners, she is hopeful that her business will generate a steady income and improve her financial stability and the quliaty of life for her family, who currently live in poverty.

loans.use: to maintain her business and purchase more of the raw materials needed for her handicrafts

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, aged 46 years, is a married man with eight children living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer, cultivating maize, groundnuts (peanuts) and tea. He wants his children to study, and also wants to build a good family house and do large scale farming for better income generation.

Francis wants the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Raquel Emperatriz

texts.es:
la sra. Raquel Emperatriz N. S. se dedica al comercio, tiene un año de haber emprendido un nuevo negocio y su actividad es la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo, venta de cosméticos.
Es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de pollo frito, pero Raquel decidió cambiar de negocio y cuenta con un año de administrar el mismo y manifiesta que le va muy bien, sus condiciones de vida han mejorado.
Doña Raquel, es casada y su esposo trabaja como motorista en la ciudad capital y de su matrimonio ya solo depende un hijo de ellos el cual esta cursando sus estudios secundarios.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa, cremas, lociones, shampoos y calzado para niños.
texts.en:
Raquel Emperatriz N. S. is a businesswoman. She began a new business a year ago; her business is sales of new clothing and shoes, and cosmetics sales. It is notable that during this time she has known how to run this business. She used to sell fried chicken, but Raquel decided to change businesses, and she has run this one for a year and it is going very well for her. Her living conditions have improved. Doña Raquel is married, and her husband works as a driver in the capital city, and their only dependent now is a son who is in secondary school. She will use the loan to buy clothing, creams, lotions, shampoos and children's footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Children's clothing, creams, lotions, shampoos, children's footwear

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria T. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería (PULPERIA) negocio en el cual cuenta con varios años de experiencia.
El negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico en la calle principal de Villa Santa y el local es de un ambiente agradable, en su negocio se encuentra lo mas básico para el consumo diario como ser: Azúcar, Arroz, Manteca, Jabón, espaguetis, salsa, huevos, harina, pollo, etc.
Doña Maria es viuda quedando ella como madre y padre para sus hijos de los cuales ya solo uno depende a un 100% de ella.
La Sra. Maria es una persona con mucho espíritu de trabajo y lo a demostrado ya que al quedar sin su compañero de hogar ella sigue luchando.
En la actualidad la Sra. Torres, no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir más su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María T. is a grocer; she’s been in this line of work for several years. Her store is located in a very strategic spot on Villa Santa’s main street; it is a pleasant space. One can find the most basic daily use items there such as: sugar, rice, lard, soap, pasta, sauces, eggs, flour, chicken, etc. María is a widow who was left being both mother and father to her children only one of whom still depends 100% on her. María has a lot of spirit for work and has shown that having been left without her life partner she continues fighting to survive. She currently lacks sufficient capital to stock her store. She will use the loan to buy stock items for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, beans, rice, sugar, lard, cooking oil, tortillas, corn flour, wheat flour, margarine, bread, cookies, juices, churros (dough shaped into sticks or rings, deep fried and sprinkled with sugar and cinnamon), soups, pasta, sauces, cereal, toilet paper.

loans.name: Kasali Abagambakmu Group

texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Wilfred is married with two children and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has a semi-permanent house.

Wilfred has a tea plantation which he inherited from his parents fourteen years ago. He dreams of expanding his tea plantation to five acres, having a permanent house, and owning a motorcycle. He wants the loan to buy fertilizer for his tea plantation so that he can realize better yields.

Wilfred is a member of Kasali Abagambakmu group, where each group member is a guarantor to the others for the loans they take. It works because they know each other and character is the defining requirement for one to be a member of the group.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his tea plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Juan Elias

texts.es:
El señor Juan Elias García se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, en el taxi No. 31 el cual tiene varios años de conducir, tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad es mas casi todo el tiempo se a dedicado al transporte de taxi. las personas lo prefieren por ser una persona muy respetuosa. 
Don Juan vive en unión libre y su compañera de hogar se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la elaboración de chicharras (Pellejas de Cerdo) 
De la relación entre ambos, tiene un hijo el cual depende en un 100% de ellos y con los ingresos que le genera el transporte el cubre todos las gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar repuestos para arreglar el automovil.
texts.en:
El señor Juan Elias García has driven taxi number 31 for several years. Not only does he have a great deal of experience in this work, he drives his taxi almost all the time. People prefer him because he is very respectful. Don Juan lives in a common law marriage and his partner makes pork cracklings (pork rinds). They have a boy who is 100% dependent on them, and the income from taxi driving pays all the expenses of their home. He will use this loan to buy parts to fix the automobile.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase parts for automobile

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel N. is from the town of Talibon. He is 34 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Daniel owns and runs a fishing business, operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish in the market. Daniel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years.

Daniel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daniel has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a boat engine. This will be the third loan taken out by Daniel from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Dinorah Judith

texts.es:
La señora Dinorah Méndez tiene 6 años de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo para damas, caballeros y niños, gorras, colas para pelo y tambien una gran variedad de ropa interior.
Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la Terminal de transporte de esta ciudad, una de las terminales mas utilizadas por las personas que viajan a diferentes partes del departamento.
El crecimiento de su negocio es notable gracias a la buena administración, la excelente atención a los clientes y a la buena ubicación del mismo.   
Doña Dinorah vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar es comerciante individual posee un carro el cual utiliza para hacer viajes, con su compañero de hogar tienen 3 hijos de los cuales dependen a un 100% de ellos y en la actualidad esta esperando otro bebe.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Dinorah Méndez has been a merchant for six years. Her main activity is selling clothes and footwear for women, men, and children. She also sells hats, ponytail accessories, and a great variety of underwear. Her business is located in the city’s transportation terminal. It is one of the terminals most used by people who travel to different parts of the department. The growth of her business is notable thanks to the good administration, the excellent attention to customers, and its good location. Dinorah is in a common-law marriage, and her companion is an individual merchant. He has a car, which he uses to make trips. They have three children who are 100% dependent upon them. She is currently expecting another baby. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise and better stock her business. She needs the income to cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sandals, belts, billfolds, blouses, shirts, hats, shoes, necklaces, ponytail accessories, and  hairpins

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gonzalina

texts.es:
La señora Gonzalina Rodríguez actualmente tiene 2 negocios, los cuales son la venta de abarrotería, estan ubicados uno en su casa de habitación en la Colonia Bella Vista de esta ciudad mismo que opera bajo el nombre de “Pulpería Bucardo”, el cual queda a cargo de su hijo,  mientras ella atiende el segundo negocio ubicado en la Terminal de transporte de esta ciudad.
La señora Rodríguez tiene 7 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar ya que el crecimiento de sus negocios es notable y sus condiciones de vida son favorables.
Gonzalina vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar labora como obrero en una fábrica de tabacos y de la relación entre ambos han procreado 2 hijos los cuales dependen a un 100% de ellos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para susrtir su pulperia ya que desea tener mayores ganancias para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gonzalina R. actually has two businesses, both are grocery sales, one of which is located in her house in Colonia Bella Vista which operates under the name "Pulperia Bucardo" which her son is in charge of while she runs the second business located in the transport terminal of the city. Mrs. R. has dedicated herself to this activity for seven years and during this time she has run her stores wisely so that they have grown significantly and her living conditions are favorable. Gonzalina lives in a common law marriage and her partner works as a laborer in a tobacco factory. Between them, they've had two children who depend upon them one hundred percent. She will use the loan to purchase merchandise to stock her grocery stores because she would like to have greater earnings to further increase the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 42 years old. Carmelita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years. Her husband is a farmer and she also helps him sell his harvest to the market.

Carmelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lilian Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Lilian M. se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de comida, Lilian cuenta con un negocio que opera bajo el nombre de Comedor “San Simón” ubicado en la Terminal de buses de Danli, contando con seis (6) años de experiencia en la administración del mismo.
Este negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, ya que es allí en donde se reune la mayor parte de personas que viajan de las aldeas a la ciudad que son las personas que representan la mayor parte de su clientela.
La Sra. M. vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar labora como revisor de puros en una fabrica de tabacos, tienen 4 hijos los cuales dependen a un 100% de ellos y con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella colabora a su esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales para la fabricacion de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Lilian M. is a businesswoman. Her main activity is food sales. Lilian has a business called Comedor San Simón, located in the Danli bus terminal, and she has six years of experience running this business. This business is in a strategic location, since it is where most of the people who travel from the towns to the city meet, and these people represent most of her customers. Mrs. M. is in a relationship, and her partner works as a cigar inspector in a tobacco factory. They have four children who depend 100% on them, and with the income from her business she works with her partner to cover certain household expenses. She will use the loan to buy materials for making her foods.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pork, beef, chicken, tortillas, vegetables, lard, oil, soft drinks, condiments, eggs, dairy products, sausages, bread, coffee, juice

loans.name: Crescenciana

texts.en:
Crescenciana T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 46 years old. Crescenciana is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Crescenciana owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Crescenciana also cooks meat that she sells in her neighborhood. She says she works hard to support her family financially.

Crescenciana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crescenciana is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She also plans to buy ingredients for cooking including meat and vegetables. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Crescenciana from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She also plans to buy ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Mirian Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora Mirian Sánchez se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa interior nueva para damas y niños, su negocio esta ubicado en la Terminal de buses costado norte de la empresa Contreras.
La señora Sánchez cuenta con cinco años de experiencia en su negocio.
 
Su negocio es semi ambulante ya que los días: lunes, viernes y sábados, se ubica en la Terminal de transporte y los días martes, miércoles y domingos lo hace de manera ambulante.
La Sra. Mirian es casada y madre de tres hijos los cuales dependen a un 100% del matrimonio su esposo es Pastor de una iglesia Evangélica.
Mirian tomo la decisión de dedicarse al negocio ya que la situación económica para ellos no era muy favorable y ahora con los ingresos que le genera su negocio colabora con su esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa interior.
texts.en:
Mirian Sánchez is a merchant; her main activity is the sale of women’s and children’s underwear. Her stand is in the bus terminal on the north side of the Contreras firm. She has five years experience. Her business is semi-itinerant because on Mondays, Fridays and Saturdays she sets herself up in the bus terminal but on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Sundays she’s an itinerant vendor. Mirian is married and has three children who depend on her 100%. Her husband is pastor in an Evangelical church. Mirian decided to go into business because their economic situation wasn’t very favorable and now the income her business produces helps her husband meet certain household expenses. The loan will be used to buy underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's and girls' undewear.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is the resident of a small city called Chichawatni which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and well known for its agriculture industry. 
She is 39 years old and is married with A. W.. She is a mother of a son and 2 daughters.  Her eldest son is in 8th grade and daughters are in 6th and 4th grade respectively. It is very difficult for Samina to pay their school fee and that’s why she sews clothes for neighboring clients to afford their school fee. She started this work for her children because she doesn’t want them to face the same fate that she experienced in her childhood.
  
Her husband operates a medicine selling business. He runs a medicine shop in the market. He supplies medicines to different clinics and sells also to individual customers. He has been doing this work for over five years.  

Samina has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband in his business.  With the loan her husband will buy medicines in bulk to sell from his shop and to supply to the clinics as well.  Samina hopes that this investment will help her husband in establishing his business on a larger scale. 
Samina is a regular loan user of Asasah. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has maintained good repayment record in previous loan cycles.

Note: "In this photo, the group member Safia is knitting a cart (used a place to bed).

loans.use: Purchase supplies of medicine for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is married with three children and all of them are in school.  She  also takes care of additional family members.  She owns a retail shop selling cosmetics and creams.   Amina wants to use this loan of 500,000/= to buy more boxes of cosmetics and braids.  She has been in this business for five years.  She has no additional income and sells to all categories of people around the area.  Amina works seven days a week and depends on this job for a living.   She buys boxes of cosmetics from Kikuubo in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping.   Amina would like to see her business grow big and eventually start selling at wholesale only.  She decided to join MCDT because of the low interest they charged and the services that are brought to the people.  She resides in and rents a two roomed house which acts as her business premise and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics and braids

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El Sr. Andrés H. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotaría, negocio que opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “San Antonio”  en el cual cuenta con varios años de experiencia y es notable que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar, su negocio es uno de los que luce de mejor surtido en el Barrio Santa Maria en donde el reside.
El señor H. es soltero, de él dependen 2 personas de los cuales don Andrés cubre los gastos de alimentación, vestuario, salud y vivienda.      
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio a logrado mejorar sus condiciones de vida, se puede observar el crecimiento del mismo, además el señor Andrés a logrado establecer un nuevo negocio al frente de una gasolinera.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrés H. is a merchant, and his primary activity is selling groceries. His business operates under the name of San Antonio Mini Market. He has several years of experience. It is notable that during this time he has known how to manage the business. His business is one of the better stocked in the Santa Maria neighborhood, where he lives. Mr. H. is single, and there are two people who are dependent upon him. He covers their food, clothing, health, and housing expenses. With the earnings from his business he has managed to improve his living conditions. He has been able to observe the growth for himself. Also, Andrés has managed to establish a new business is front of a gas station. He will use the loan to buy more merchandise to better stock his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, rice, sugar, condensed milk, powdered milk, soft drinks, juice, soup, pastas, salsas, pills, coffee, cookies, corn flour, wheat flour, batteries, candles, butter, oil, toilet paper, aluminum foil, sanitary napkins, sweets, chiles, vinegar, and condiments

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from Barangay San Jose in the town of Talibon. She is 24 years old, married and has two young kids. She raises pigs to fatten and sell. She also makes rice cakes that she sells in the morning. In the afternoon, she makes "halo-halo", a popular dessert snack in the Philippines. It is a mixture of shaved ice and milk to which are added various boiled sweet beans and fruits. Elizabeth also cooks fried chicken. She spends time feeding the pigs late in the afternoon. 

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elizabeth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Gloria De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria de Jesus C. se dedica al comercio, venta de abarrotería negocio el cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “LYLI”. Doña Gloria tiene 6  años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, además de dedicarse al negocio de pulpería también  se dedica a la compra de leche y transforma este producto para venta en: queso, cuajada, requesón y mantequilla. 
La señora Gloria es viuda ya que su esposo fue asesinado en Diciembre del año pasado, pero a pesar de ese percance doña Gloria continua saliendo adelante con su familia, ya que ahora sus 3 hijos dependen totalmente de ella.
con los ingresos recibidos de sus negocios esta pagando los gastos de salud, alimentación, vivienda, vestuario y estudio de sus hijos.  
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria de Jesús C. is a grocer; she has a store called “Pulpería LYLI.” She has six years experience in this line of work. In addition to her grocery store she also buys milk to make cheeses and butter. Gloria is a widow; her husband was assassinated in December of last year. Despite this tragedy, Gloria continues forward with her family since now her three children are totally dependent on her alone. With income from her businesses she is paying for her children’s food, health, clothing and schooling. The loan will be used to buy stock items for her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn flour, wheat flour, lard, cooking oil, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, soups, pasta, sauces, tooth paste, toilet paper, eggs, tortillas, juices, soft drinks.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Ms. Irene F. E. of Sitio Calvon, Mambog, Binangonan, Rizal, Philippines, is married. She is 36 years of age. Since 2007, Irene E. has been a member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., an MFI partner of Kiva. She came from the Rizal Southwest Branch in Binangonan, Province of Rizal, Philippines. 

The couple was blessed with four children: Joyce Ann is 17 years old, Bernard is 15, Irish is 12 and the youngest, Michaella, is 10 years old. Her eldest graduated from high school but unfortunately, because of financial constraints, she stopped school and is now helping in their buying and selling business. 

Despite all the trials in life, Ms. Irene keeps on dreaming for the future of her family, especially her children. She wanted to send them to school and somehow pursue a career because it is the only treasure they can inherit from her. She did not want them to experience the fate she suffered because her parents dis not have the resources to send them to school. 

Her desire to bring a bright future for her children encouraged Ms. E. to join Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., and start a business. She joined the organization in the year 2007 and became an active member. Her intention is also to enhance her awareness about the program and at the same time join the groups of people in her neighborhood and meet new friends. She is glad indeed that ASHI also provides the financial assistance to poor families without collateral or guarantee. From then on, she has enjoyed being a member. 
   
Now, with the help from ASHI and Kiva, she wishes to apply for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to fund her capital because of the demand in her business of buying and selling silver jewelry and products. With this loan, she is optimistic that their income will certainly increase and they can supply the orders of her clients on time and, of course, support her family.

loans.use: Buying and selling silver jewelry and products

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 58 years old. Linda is married and has nine children. Most of her children are adults and are married already but she still has younger children who go to school. To make a living, Linda raises pigs for fattening and sale.

Linda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the first loan taken out by Linda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima lives in a three room brick house in the small city of Chichawatni in south Punjab, Pakistan, famous for its agriculture industry. She is a 29-year-old housewife who also operates a sewing business from her home. She is very skilled at her craft and gets regular orders from her neighbors, charging them between 100-150 PKRs for each dress stitching. Fatima is the mother of three children who don’t yet go to school. She is married to U. M. who is involved in a bread-making and selling business in the market. He makes bread in an oven made of mud and heated with wood. He sells each bread for 5 PKRs. He is well known for his quality work and gets regular orders. He has 15 years of experience in this work. Fatima has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan amount to buy flour in bulk and increase his business income. Fatima hopes that by making positive use of the loan, her husband will be able to improve his business and she will be able to send her children to school soon.

Fatima is a regular lender with Asasah and is in her third loan cycle. In previous loan years, she has proved herself to be a responsible client; she never missed any meeting and paid her installments on time.

loans.use: to purchase flour in bulk for a bread-making and selling business

loans.name: Sayra Esmelin

texts.es:
La señora Sayra R. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de producos para la limpieza del hogar, cosméticos y plásticos de manera domiciliar y ambulante, además de este negocio también se dedica a la repostería (elaboración de pasteles), mismo con el que cuenta con seis años de experiencia.
La señora R. convive actualmente con el señor Héctor Enrique Castellanos el cual se dedica a la ganadería.
Del hogar de los señores Castellanos R. dependen sus 4 hijos y con las ganancias percibidas del negocio de la señora R. ayuda a su compañero de hogar a pagar los gastos de alimentación, vivienda, salud y educación de sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar productos de limpieza, cremas y lociones.
texts.en:
Sayra R. works in commerce. Her main activity is the home sale of household cleaning products, cosmetics and plastic utensils. She also works baking (cakes) and has six years of experience.
