She also sells watches that she distributes to her friends and acquaintances. Eulalia requests a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil. Eulalia dreams of buying a car for her personal use.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban tiene 43 años está acompañado con la señora Antonia López, tienen una hija de 12 años que acaba de culminar la primaria.
 
Esteban se dedica a la elaboración de chipas hace más de 10 años, lo realiza en su propio domicilio, donde cuenta con todas las herramientas necesarias, posteriormente su señora se encarga de la comercialización en forma ambulante, ya sea en ómnibus que transitan sobre la Ruta Nº 1 o por las calles de la ciudad, ésta labor la realiza junto con tres señoras más.
Esta actividad siempre le ayudó a su familia en todo, como para la alimentacion, vivienda y una buena edducación.

Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de una computadora para su hija que se encuentra estudiando.
texts.en:
Esteban, age 43, is accompanied in life by Antonia López. They have a 12 year old daughter who just finished elementary school. Esteban has been making cheese buns for over ten years. He makes them in his own house, where he has all of the necessary tools. Later, his companion is in charge of selling the buns in an itinerant way. Sometimes she sells on the bus that travels route1, and sometimes she sells on the city’s streets. She does this work with three other women. This activity has always helped his family with everything like food, housing, and a good education. He intends to use the loan to buy a computer for his daughter who is in school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Jesus Is Lord Group

texts.en: Mardia L., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Jesus Is Lord. She is 45 years old, widowed, and has five children between five and 25 years old. She is a sophomore college student. For 5 years, she has sold home-made bread on S.K.D Boulevard outside Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 60,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, and eggs for her bread making. She describes herself as a faithful woman whose dream is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and eggs to make bread

loans.name: Maisha Plus Group

texts.en: Albert O. is the manager of the group “Maisha Plus” made up of 17 members who have firmly united to receive loans from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses. Albert O. runs a drugstore in the western surburb of Kinshasa. He started his business in 2005. With hard work, good management and Hope’s loans, his business has prospered. He is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC and has already received six loans -- all of them repaid properly. Albert intends to use the next loan to buy medicine needed by his customers, and add to his working capital. Each week, his business brings in a profit of $60. His ambition is to expand his business by opening drugstores in other places. Albert is 36 years old, married and the father of a one-year-old-child.

loans.use: to purchase medicine needed by his customers

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: K. est une dame très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes. elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de 8 ans et s'approvisionne à Lomé et au Ghana voisin. son ancienneté dans ce commerce ont fait qu'elle en a une parfaite maîtrise et sa clientèle ne cesse de grandir. elle voudrait augmenter son stock de marchandises pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, elle demande alors un crédit pour l'achat de 15 pièces de pagnes de grande et moyenne qualité.
texts.en:
K. is a very dynamic lady and has an income-generating activity selling "pagnes" (a West African term for decorative fabric). She has been carrying out this business for more than eight years and gets her supplies in Lomé and neighboring Ghana. Her long experience in this business means that she masters it very well and her customer base is constantly growing. She would like to increase her stock of goods in order to be able to satisfy her customers more readily. She is thus asking for a loan for the purchase of 15 pieces of good and medium-quality "pagnes".

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras hace 7 años y lo que mas le gusta son las reuniones amenas, divertidas, además ser responsables.
Natividad es casada, tiene 2 hijos y ahora solo vive con su esposo, Natividad se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos, galletas, actividad que realiza en horno alquilado con la ayuda de trabajadores, sus productos los vende en 3 ferias a donde viaja.
Natividad solicita un crédito de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, aceite.
Los sueños de Natividad es cambiar de negocio por otro menos trabajoso y tener cabinas de Internet.
texts.en:
Natividad has been a member of the Communal Bank “Obreras” (Workers) for seven years and what she likes most are the pleasant meetings, having fun, and being responsible. She is married, has two children, and now lives alone with her husband. Natividad produces traditional breads and cookies. She completes her work using a rented oven and with the assistance of her employees. Her products are sold at three fairs where she travels.

Natividad is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to invest in the purchase of flour and oil. Her dreams include switching to a business that requires less work and acquiring some Internet booths.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour & oil

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras hace 10 años y lo que mas le agrada es la disciplina y las capacitaciones que recibe.
Filomena es viuda, tiene 7 hijos pero ahora vive solo con un N. que esta a su responsabilidad. Filomena viaja a las ferias D. donD. compra cereales, y luego los comercializa en un puesto del mercado mariscal Cáceres. Además Filomena se dedica a la agricultura D. papa, cereales en sus terrenos D. Matara. El deseo D. Filomena es ampliar su negocio.
Filomena necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. quinua.
texts.en:
Filomena has been a member of the Communal Bank “Obreras” (Workers) for 10 years and what she likes most are the discipline of her group and the training that she receives. She is a widow with seven children, but now she lives alone with a grandson for whom she is responsible. Filomena travels to the fairs where she buys grains and later sells them at a stand at the Mariscal Cáceres Market. She also grows potatoes and grain on her land in Matara. Her wish is to expand her business.

Filomena needs a loan of 1000 PEN so that she can invest in the purchase of quinoa.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quinoa

loans.name: God First Group

texts.en:
Albertha W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God First. She is 29 years old, married and has three children who range in age from eight months to twelve years. She also cares for two siblings. Albertha was only able to attend school through ninth grade due to a lack of financial support. She describes herself as a determined woman.

For six years she has been selling fish in Thinkers’ Village outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 14,000 LRD portion of this 70,000 LRD group loan to buy more cartons of fish. Her goals are to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días, además junto a su esposo tienen una carpintería en su misma casa. 
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras hace 15 años y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro, Graciela es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Graciela solicita un crédito de 1400 para la compra de madera.
Graciela sueña con que sus hijos culminen sus estudios e implementar una ferretería.
texts.en:
Graciela has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, fruits, and beverages. She manages her business every day. In addition, she manages with her husband a carpentry shop that is also in their house. Graciela has been a member of the Communal Bank “Obreras” (Workers) for 15 years and what she enjoys most is having the incentive to save. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Graciela is requesting a loan of 1400 PEN to buy wood. She dreams of seeing her children finish their studies and opening a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood for her carpentry business

loans.name: Susan Gabriela

texts.es:
Susan pertenece al Banco Comunal Obreras hace 1 año y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro y la responsabilidad.
Susan es casada y tiene 2 hijas pequeñas, vive en la casa de sus suegros, Susan y su esposo tienen un taller de Metal Mecánica en un local alquilado, tiene además personal que trabaja con ellos, Susan se encarga de la administración del negocio, como cobranzas, compra de materiales.
Susan solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de fierros.
Los sueños de Susan son tener una casa propia y un local propio para el taller.
texts.en:
Susan joined the Communal Bank “Obreras” (Workers) a year ago and what she likes most about being a member is having the incentive to save and be responsible. She is married, has two young daughters, and lives at the house of her in-laws. Susan and her husband operate a metal workshop from a rented location. They also have a staff that works for them. Susan is in charge of managing the business. Her duties include collecting payments and buying materials.

Susan is requesting a loan for 2000 PEN to buy iron. She dreams of having her own home and acquiring her own space for her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase iron

loans.name: Dewonpele#3 Group

texts.en:
Kumba P., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Dewonpele#3. Kumba is 39 years old, married and has four children who range from 12 to 23 years old. 

She was only able to attend school through 7th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For seven years, she has been selling baby blankets, powder and soap in the Waterside market in Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 80,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of baby blankets, powder and soap. 

She describes herself as a jovial woman.

Her goals are to improve her business and build a house. In the photo that accompanies this profile, P. M.'s picture is in the inset because he was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of baby blankets, powder and soap

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 36 años, vive en compañía de su único hijo en casa de sus padres. Hace un año y medio que tiene un estudio fotográfico, ofreciendo el servicio de fotografía, así como de impresión de fotos digitales y análogas. Su establecimiento esta ubicado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Tarma.  Desde entonces trabaja todos los días y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece a sus clientes ha logrado ganar más. Afirma que le gusta esta actividad, porque no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico además de que  siempre  le agrado tomar fotos y retocarlas. En adelante desea tener equipos más sofisticados para su estudio fotográfico. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una cámara digital con mayor resolución de imagen, de esa manera podrá mejorar la calidad de su servicio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old and lives with her only son in her parent's house. For a year and a half she has had a photographic studio where she offers photographic services, and also prints digital and film photos. Her establishment is located in a central area of the city of Tarma. Since she works every day, and thanks to the good service she offers her customers, she has managed to increase her earnings. She states that she enjoys this activity, because it doesn't require a lot of physical effort, and also she likes to take photos and retouch them. In this future she wants to have more sophisticated equipment for her photographic studio. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she is pleased to have financial support, since she has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she enjoys being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and cooperative people. She thanks those persons who will administer the loan that she requests, which will be very useful in helping her to make progress with her business. With the loan she requests, she will invest in the purchase of a digital camera with better resolution, so that in this way she will be able to offer better quality services.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es: Dámaso tiene 62 años, su estado civil es soltero. Tiene dos hijos y todos estudian. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos básicos de cocina como achote, canela, pimienta, sal, comino. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza, por lo que ha sido de mucha ayuda. Ha demostrado ser un apersona que paga sus cuotas puntuales, tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que todos los días recorre muchas calles para ofrecer sus diferentes productos. Este financiamiento lo realiza con el fin de comprar canela, salsa de tomate, salsa inglesa, anís, romero, ajo, pimienta y curry. Desea tener un lugar estable para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Dámaso is 62 years old, single, and has two children who are studying. He has a business selling basic cooking products such as achiote, cinnamon, pepper, salt, and cumin. This is not the first loan he has taken, and the ones he already received were a great help. Dámaso has demonstrated that he is a person who submits his payments on time. He has been in business for more than six years and spends every day traveling through several streets to offer his various products.

This loan will be used to buy cinnamon, tomato sauce, Worcestershire sauce, anise, rosemary, garlic, pepper, and curry. He wants to have a stable place for his business so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cinnamon, tomato sauce, Worcestershire sauce, anise, rosemary, garlic, pepper, and curry

loans.name: Las Vegas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Las Vegas” actualmente se encuentra en el ciclo VI  y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Institución de Micro finanzas Arariwa que está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq provincia del Cusco. La mayoría de los socios se dedican al comercio. 

Kathia nació  en la ciudad de Cusco y tiene 36 años, Actualmente, Kathia vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con su pareja  y sus tres hijos.  Actualmente,  Kathia vende ropa, perfumes y joyas de forma particular, ella vende a sus amigos, vecinos y trabajadores de instituciones públicas y privadas, ella viaja dos veces a las ciudades de Lima y Tacna para comprar más mercadería. Le pueden encontrar en su domicilio, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las una de la tarde. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Kathia que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su tienda esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar joyas, ropa y muchas cosas más.  Kathia es una de los socias fundadores del banco comunal y es una persona puntual y responsable con el pago de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The Las Vegas village bank is currently in its sixth loan cycle. Its hardworking, enterprising members are always looking for opportunities to improve their lives and work daily to provide a better future for their children. The group meets every thirty days in the main office of the Institución de Microfinanzas Arariwa, located in the Wanchaq district of Cusco province. Most of the members sell products for a living. Kathia is 36 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, where she was born, with her partner and their three children. Kathia sells clothing, perfumes, and jewelry to friends, neighbors, and workers in public and private institutions. She travels to the cities of Lima and Tacna twice in order to purchase more merchandise. She sells from home seven days a week, from 9 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. For her next loan, Kathia hopes to receive 1000 soles. At the moment her store is modestly stocked with the basic necessities. She'd like to use the loan to buy jewelry, clothing, and much more. Kathia is one of the founding members of the village bank and is punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry, clothing, and much more

loans.name: Comlanvi

texts.fr: ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d'un genre particulier qui est le commerce de produits cosmétiques. il fait ce commerce dans sa propre boutique. sa clientèle est exclusivement composée de femmes. il réalise de bonnes recettes. la demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevée, il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 11 cartons de pharmapur, 5 cartons de savons de beauté, 3 cartons de lotion de beauté, 7 cartons de pâtes dentifrices et divers.
texts.en:
This gentleman makes a living selling cosmetics. He works in his own store. His clientele is solely made up of women. He has a good income. Since his merchandise is currently in high demand, he came to WAGES and applied for a loan to buy 11 boxes of pharmapur soap, 5 boxes of beauty soap, 3 boxes of beauty lotion, 7 boxes of toothpaste and a few other items.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Nancy Yohanna

texts.es:
Nancy de 27 años, tiene un pequeño Cyber y vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Fortín” y caracterizada por su pobreza y sus caminos de tierra. 

Ella comenzó con el negocio del Cyber hace 5 años atrás, trabajando solo con una copiadora y una computadora, como en el sector por donde vive era mucha la demanda comenzó a comprar mas computadoras, así poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias hasta que pudo tener su propio local. Ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am, también recarga cartuchos de impresoras.  

Para dar una mejor atención a la clientela quiere comprar con el préstamo computadoras. En el futuro quiere terminar con éxito sus carrera de ingeniera en sistemas.
texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old. She has a small "Cyber" and lives in the suburban zone of Guayaquil called "Fortín" characterized by povery and dirt roads.

She started the "Cyber" business 5 years ago working with a copy machine and a computer, but as there was a huge demand in the area she began to buy more computers, and little by little her profits increased and she got her own premises. Now she works from 6:00 am and she also refills print cartridges.

To offer better service to her customers she wants to buy computers with the loan. Her future plans are to finish successfully her studies in system engineering.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: L. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de friperie. elle a une ancienneté de 8 ans dans ce commerce c'est pourquoi elle maîtrise tout le contour de ce commerce. elle s'approvisionne au marché  Local de hedzranawoé où ce commerce est très développé.son stock de marchandises est en baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 5 balles de friperie. avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra bien vendre et satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. L. has a revenue-generating business in second-hand clothing.  She has eight years of seniority in this business.  This is why she has a command of all its aspects. She gets her supplies at the local market in Hedzranawoé, where this commerce is highly developed.  Ms. L. is low on merchandise.  She is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying 5 bales of used clothing.  With this new stock, she will be able to do well in her sales and to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying used clothing

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette  is a hardworking mother of three children with ages that range from 1 week to 12 years. All her children are in school apart from the youngest. Her husband grows a few crops and buys and sells various items. 

Bernadette has a shop with various household products, such as saucepans, sugar, flasks, snacks, etc. She hopes to buy more household items to sell with her loan. Her shop is in the center of their village and that is why she has a large clientele.

loans.use: Buying more household items

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es: El señor Bacilio vive en la comunidad de Pampa el Coscal provincia de Cordillera en el Municipio de Cabezas donde trabaja en la agricultura sembrando maiz, sandia pero todo lo que siembra es para vender en el mercado de El Torno y no lo hace en su municipio, el ya esta trabajando 7 años con Emprender también logro comprarse una vagoneta donde lleva sus productos a vender al mercado esto le facilita mucho, el dinero del credito es para la contratacion de mano de obra para la peparacion de la tierra para la siembra de Maiz, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, El nacio en Cbba. y hace 25 años que vive en la Pampa el Coscal.
texts.en:
Mr. Bacilio lives in the community of Pampa el Coscal, province of Cordillera in the Municipality of Cabezas where he works in agriculture, planting corn and watermelon. His entire crop is sold at the market "El Torno" and not in his municipality. He has been working 7 years with Emprender and has managed to buy a station wagon to take his products to the market, and this makes it easier for him. The money from the loan is to hire people to prepare the land for planting the corn. He is a hard-working person and very responsible with the repayments. He was born in Cbba. and has been living for 25 years in Pampa el Coscal.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Preparation of farm land for planting corn

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie was born in 1959 and is a hard-working mother with six children. Her eldest child is 21 years old while the youngest is 7 years old. She is married to a farmer and they both work hard to raise their children. 

Epiphanie sells green bananas and she has done this business for 30 years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more green bananas and increase her sales.

loans.use: Buying green bananas

loans.name: Felicita Hortencia

texts.es: Felicita Hortencia tiene 26 años de edad, ella tiene 1 hijo de 5 años a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas, esta joven es muy emprendedora pues todos los días se levanta temprano a las 5 de la mañana pues hay que moler el maíz y también empezar la elaboración de sus tortillas  la mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinos, es así que junto a su esposo que se dedica a brindar el servicio de tricitaxi pues juntos le han proporcionado a su vivienda algunas mejoras. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de comal, maíz, leña, bolsas plásticas así mejorara su servicio y tendrá más ganancias.
texts.en:
Felicita Hortencia is 26 years old, she is responsible for a 5-year-old son. For a living she makes and sells tortillas. She is a very entrepreneurial young lady. She gets up at 5:00 in the morning to grind the corn and start making her tortillas as the majority of her customers are neighbors. Her husband offers tricycle taxi service and together they have achieved improvements to their home. She requests this loan to buy a hotplate for cooking, corn, firewood, and plastic bags to improve her business and obtain more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Felix nacido en Cbba. tiene 46 años de edad casado con la Sra. Fermina tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar, ahora viven en Pampa el Coscal hace 20 años que el vive y trabaja juntamente con su esposa y sus hijos siembra maiz, mani, sandia y otros, su esposa le ayuda en la comercializacion de los productos que el cosecha, todo lo que el siemra saca a vender al mercado de El Torno, el dinero del credito lo utilizara en la contartatacion de mano de obra para la preparacion de la tierra y para la compra de semillas, es una persona trabajadora, y esta muy agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Felix was born in Cochabamba. He is 46 years old and is married to Fermina. They have 4 school-aged children, and now have lived in Pampa el Coscal for the past 20 years. He lives and works together with his wife and their children cultivating corn, peanuts, watermelon and other products. His wife helps him sell the products that he harvests. He takes everything he harvests to sell in the El Torno market. The money from this loan will be used to hire workers to prepare the land and to buy the seeds. He is a hardworking person, and he is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to hire workers to prepare the land using slash and burn techniques and to plant corn

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: D. a ouvert  en 2007 sa propre boutique qu'elle appelle "EL SAHLOM", dans cette boutique, elle vend des fourniture de bureau et fait aussi le traitement de texte de même que la photocopie. elle a besoin de s'approvisionner en fournitures de bureau, c'est pour cette raison qu'elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour remplir sa boutique avec  10 cartons de Bics, 35 cartons de papiers A4, 15 blocs de chemises, 10 blocs d'enveloppes, 10 blocs de cahiers et divers. Elle est célibataire et habite le quartier AVEMARIA qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé.
texts.en:
D. opened her own shop in 2007, called 'El Sahlom', where she sells office supplies and also offers printing services, such as photocopying. She needs to replenish her stock of office supplies and is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 10 boxes of Bic pens, 35 packs of A4 paper, 15 packs of folders, 10 packs of envelopes, 10 packs of notepads, among other things. She is single and lives in the Ave Maria quarter, which is on the outskirts of the town of Lomé.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of office supplies

loans.name: Anselme

texts.en:
Anselme was born in 1976. He is not yet married and he takes care of his sister. He has a hair salon and he is requesting a loan to buy other hair-cutting equipment. He has done this business for seven years and this has helped him earn a living.  

He hopes to build up the equipment in his salon to service more customers and generate more income.

loans.use: Hair-cutting equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increasing the size of the area for growing crops, and purchasing fertiliser

loans.name: Nouhou

texts.fr: nouhou exerce comme activités génératrices de revenu le commerce de portables et des accessoires de téléphones portables. il s'approvisionne à lomé, plus précisément au quartier commercial de dékon où ce commerce est très développé. il fait ce commerce depuis 2004 et sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. il a besoin de s'approvisionner en nouvelles gammes de téléphones portables de même que les accessoires, il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une vingtaine de nouveaux portables, de même qu'une variété d'accessoires de téléphones portables.
texts.en:
Nouhou makes his living selling mobile telephones and accessories. He sources his goods from the business quarter of Dékon in Lomé, where this type of business is very developed. He has been involved in this industry since 2004 and he has a large and varied customer base. He needs to offer a larger range of mobile telephones and accessories, and so is seekieng a loan from WAGES in order to purchase around 20 new phones as well as a variety of accessories.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of mobile telephones and accessories

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a 73-year-old mother with four children. Her children range from the age of 27 to 46 years of age. Two of her children are in school. The rest of her children are married. 

She sells soft drinks and with the loan she hopes to buy more soft drinks in order to make more profits. With the profits, Bernadette plans to renovate her house. She says that her business is well-known because it’s located in a trading center.

loans.use: Purchasing more soft drinks to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Margaritas 1 Group

texts.es: Doña Gloria Modesta González es mama soltera, ha cursado el quinto grado primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales   siguen a su cargo, ella se dedica al comercio tienda de consumo diario, tiene 15 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina Las Margaritas 1, El grupo cuenta con Seis  integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales, Artesanía elaboración de Camisas  y blusas,  y crianza de animales domesticas,   El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de mercadería para su tienda de consumo diario y así incrementar el volumen de ventas, espera obtener mejores ganancias en la actividad que realiza cada una de ellas.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria Modesta González is a single mother who has studied through the fifth grade of primary school and has three children she cares for. She has worked for 15 years running a store that provides items for everyday use. Counting on their enthusiasm and mutual help several neighbors have organized a group to apply for a loan. This solidarity group is called Las Margaritas 1. The group consists of six women who work in diverse fields, among which we can mention raising animals, handicraft production of shirts and blouses, and raising domestic animals. Gloria will use the loan to buy merchandise for her everyday items store and increase the volume of sales. Each one of them hopes to obtain increased earnings from her work.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Extend her farming land

loans.name: Foussena

texts.fr: O. est une jeune fille célibataire qui s'est il y a 2 ans dans le commerce en détail des ustensiles de cuisine comme les casseroles, les plats et divers. elle s'approvisionne à Lomé. dans son quartier, elle est la seule à détenir le monopole de ce commerce ce qui lui permet de réaliser de bonnes recettes. son stock de marchandises est en baisse, elle doit se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 15 casseroles de bonnes qualités, une vingtaine de plats et divers autres ustensiles de cuisine.
texts.en:
O. is a young single woman who two years ago set up a retail business selling kitchenware, such as saucepans, dishes and other items. She gets her supplies in Lomé. She has a monopoly of this business in her neighborhood which allows her to make a good income. Her stock of goods is falling and she needs to get fresh supplies. She is thus requesting a loan from WAGES in order to by 15 good-quality saucepans, around twenty dishes and various other items of kitchenware.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchenware

loans.name: Juana Lidia

texts.es:
Juana de 43 años, ella tiene una papelería (en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”). Vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Fortín” y caracterizada por su pobreza y sus caminos de tierra.  

Comenzó con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  

Para incrementar sus ingresos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos y dulces ya que la mayoría de clientes son niños. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa, y con los ingresos poder ayuda a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana, 43, has a stationery store (in Ecuador, it is called a "bazar.") She lives in a neighborhood in the outskirts of Guayaquil called "Fortin," which is characterized by its poverty and its dirt roads. Juana started her stationery business so that she could support her family, selling notebooks, pens and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances. When she had enough money she set up a small stationery store in the front of her house. She works from 8am until 8pm every day. To increase her income she wants to use the loan to buy notebooks and sweets, since the majority of her customers are children. In the future she wants to make improvements to her house and be able to help her children with her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy notebooks and sweets

loans.name: Suyapa Ivonne

texts.es: Suyapa Ivonne tiene 26 años, Su actividad económica es la venta de recargas, venta de de Dvd y discos de audio,  ella tiene más de 6 años con esta actividad este no es el primera experiencia que ha tenido con financiamientos pues para ella han sido muy útiles para mejorar su negocio. ella tiene mucha experiencia en su actividad es por eso que se siente muy contenta pues siempre que llegan sus clientes los atiende con mucho cariño y entusiasmo esto es algo que a ellos les gusta muchos. Actualmente con este financiamiento comprara recargas en grandes cantidades nuevas películas y discos.
texts.en:
26-year old Suyapa Ivonne has been earning her living by selling pre-paid phone cards, DVDs and CDs for more than six years. This will not be her first experience with loans as she has used them a lot to help her to improve her business. Suyapa has a lot of experience in this line of work, and she feels very content because whenever her customers visit, she treats them with much fondness and enthusiasm. They like her her service very much. With the loan she plans to buy a large quantity of phone cards, new movies and CDs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Las Margaritas 2 Group

texts.es: Doña Isabel Martínez M., es casada, es  una persona analfabeta, tiene 6 hijos los cuales, 4 están casados y el resto  están a su cargo, ella se dedica a la Artesanía (elaboración de camisas) tiene 10 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina Las Margaritas 2, El grupo cuenta con Seis  integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar,  Artesanía elaboración de Chumpas y pantalones,  y Agropecuario  crianza de animales domesticas,   El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de materia prima  para su negocio  y así incrementar el volumen de ventas. Una de las dificultades de ser la dueña del negocio ha sido la falta del capital.
texts.en:
Doña Isabel Martínez M. is married, and cannot read and write. She has six children, four of whom are married, and the other two still live at home. For the past ten years she has earned her living by handcrafting shirts. She relates enthusiastically how some neighbours got together to form a group and seek a loan. The group is called Las Margaritas 2 (Daisies) and is comprised of six women who have a variety of jobs such as making sweaters and pants, and raising farm animals. Isabel will use her share of the loan to buy materials for her business and thus increase her sales. One of the problems of running a business has been the lack of capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: extend the cultivated area and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Karen Lorelein

texts.es:
Karen de 23 años, vende ropa desde que salio del colegio para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Fortín”. 

Realiza su trabajo sola desde muy temprano,  vende pantalones, blusas por catalogo. . No tiene horario fijo porque sus ventas las hacen por pedido. Aunque le cuesta deja a su hijo mientas que sale a vender la ropa ella sigue trabajando para darle una mejor vida. 

Ella quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa y con las ganancias asegurar un fondo de ahorros para su hijo. En el futuro quiere tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
23-year old Karen has sold clothing ever since she left high school to help her husband with household expenses. She lives in a suburb outside Guayaquil called Fortín. Karen works alone and sets out early each day to sell pants and blouses from a catalog. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule as her sales depend on the orders she gets. Although it bothers her to leave her son while she goes out selling clothing, she continues in order to provide him with a better life. She is seeking a loan to buy more clothing and with the money she earns, she plans to start a savings fund for her son. In the future she would like to have a house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: La Bendicion 2 Group

texts.es: Doña Santa tiene cuarenta y dos años de edad, es casada, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, , tiene cuatro hijos de diferentes edades el mayor de 24 años y la mas pequeña de 10 años, el esposo se dedica a la albañilería y ella colabora con algunos gastos familiares, se dedica al comercio (venta de ropas típicas) y crianza de animales (Cerdos y pollos), cuenta con 12 años de experiencia en éstas actividades. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación y la ayuda de algunas vecinas y hermanas de la iglesia, organizan un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina LA BENDICIÓN, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes con el pensamiento de que este crédito es una bendición para ellas, El grupo cuenta con 14 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales, venta de artículos de consumo diario, alimentos y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de mercadería, así aumentar su negocio y generar más ingresos, para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Santa is 40 years old. She is married and did not have the opportunity to attend school. She has four children of different ages, the oldest being 24 and the youngest 10. Her husband works as a mason and she helps with the household expenses. She sells merchandise (clothing, typical of the region) and raises livestock (hogs and chickens). She has 12 years experience doing these things. With enthusiasm, a desire to get ahead, and with help from some neighbors and sisters from the church, they formed a group so that they would be able to request a loan. The communal bank is called “La Bendición” (The Blessing). This name was chosen by all of the members with the thought that this loan would be a blessing for them. The group is made up of 14 women who do different things, including raising livestock, food sales, and clothing sales. They will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise, grow their businesses, and increase their incomes that they will use to improve the well being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: Lupe tiene 31 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 4 años vende ropa, y lo realiza de manera ambulante u ofreciéndolo de casa en casa. Desde entonces sale a vender sus productos, dejando a crédito la mercadería que es vendida, por ello cuenta con clientes fijos. Además cada cierto tiempo viaja a la capital para abastecerse de mercadería, ya que lo consigue a un precio muy cómodo. Afirma que le agrada su trabajo, es por ello que desea tener exclusividades de modelos y diseños en prendas de vestir. Es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en al compra de prendas de vestir en cuero y otros materiales.
texts.en:
Lupe, age 31, lives with her two children in a rented house. For over four years she has been selling clothes in an itinerant manner or by going door to door. She leaves to sell her products, and she sells her merchandise on credit. Therefore, she has fixed customers. After a certain amount of time she travels to the capital to stock her merchandise because she gets it for a very comfortable price. She says that she likes her work, and she wants her garments to be exclusive models and designs. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support. She has always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. She is grateful to the people who will fund the loan she is requesting. It will be very useful to the progress of her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy clothing that is made of leather and other materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy garments made from leather and other materials and designs

loans.name: Mujeres Necesitada 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Marisol is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Necesitadas 1 & 2 (Women in need). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her older daughter and 2 grandchildren. She says that her most difficult challenge is to keep fighting by working hard to get a better future. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to be with her grandchildren.

Marisol is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over 5 years, starting with some saving she had at her home. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business and to buy a freezer, where she will hold the sea foods, She is running a Fish shop. She will use the profits to save and plan to use that money for specific needs like school for her grandchildren and to repair her house. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to work, she was wishing to invest in her new business, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for seafood business.

loans.name: Monja Blanca Group

texts.es: Doña Dolores es casada, no tuvo la oportunidad D. asistir a la escuela, pero gracias a un programa D. alfabetización donD. ella asistió, aprendió a escribir , tiene cuatro hijos, dos casados y dos solteros, el esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ella colabora con algunos gastos familiares, se dedica al comercio (Venta D. ropa y telas) en la plaza D. San Francisco el Alto, cuenta con 8 años D. experiencia en ésta actividad. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos D. superación y la ayuda D. algunas vecinas y compañeras D. negocio, organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina MONJA BLANCA, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes. El grupo cuenta con 11 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza D. animales y venta D. artículos D. consumo diario y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra D. mercadería, y D. esta forma así generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Dolores is married. She didn't have the opportunity to attend school, but thanks to a literacy program that she attended, she learned to write. She has four children, two married and two single. Her husband works in agriculture, and she helps with some of the family expenses. She has a business selling clothing and fabric in the plaza of San Francisco el Alto. She has eight years of experience in this business. She relates with enthusiasm that she wanted to aim higher, so with the help of some neighbor women and fellow business women, they organized a group so that they could apply for a loan. Their community bank was named Monja Blanca, a name chosen by all the members. The group members are 11 women who work in a variety of activities; among them, we can mention raising animals and selling household products and traditional clothing. Doña Dolores will use the loan to buy merchandise and in this way generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Lubys Gertrudis, Lisset Carolina y Margarita conforman el grupo solidario Guadalupe. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas. Lisset se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio pues fue por iniciativa propia y así con el paso del tiempo es que le ha gustado estar con esta actividad que para ella ha sido muy provechosa esta experiencia ha sido maravillosa para ella al interactuar con sus clientes. En el caso de lubys se dedica a la venta de ropa. Otra integrante es Margarita que se dedica a la venta de golosinas hace mas de 3 años,  sus inicios fueron por cuenta propia pues no tenía un salario para ayudar a sus hijos, por lo que siempre ha sido una mujer muy responsable y junto a sus amigas han decido realizar un financiamiento para comprar la materia prima necesaria para sus negocios pues hasta los momentos tienen muchos encargos.
texts.en:
Lubys Gertrudis, Lisset Carolina, and Margarita make up the solidarity group “Guadalupe”. All of them have different business activities. Lisset has been selling cosmetics for more than five years. She started this business out of her own initiative and spends her time managing it. Lisset enjoys her business and finds it to be a wonderful experience because she gets to interact with her customers.

Lubys sells clothing, while the other member Margarita has been selling candy for more than three years. They started their businesses because they did not have a salary by which they could support their children.

Lisset has always been a very responsible woman, and together with her friends, decided to obtain a loan so that they could buy merchandise for their businesses since they now have many orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 49 años, comparte su vida a lado de sus hijos, juntos viven en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 20 años practica el tejido, además estuvo trabajando en programas sociales, capacitando en el tejido a diversas mujeres. El buen prestigio que posee en el área del tejido a mano, le ha servido para instalar una tienda de venta de lana, de las cuales lo vende por madejas, además incluye el servicio de enseñar a tejer, este es su estrategia de venta para captar más clientes. Lleva 5 meses en este trabajo independiente, por lo que cada día lo disfruta, para ella el tejer es un Hobby, además le resulta rentable, es por eso que quiere crecer su negocio. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de lana al por mayor.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old. She lives along with her children in their own house. She has been knitting for more than 20 years. She has also worked in social programs, teaching many women how to knit. Her good reputation for knitting has helped her in opening her own store where she sells wool [yarn], which she sells by the skein. She also offers to teach people how to knit, which is her sales strategy for obtaining more customers. She has been doing this work independently for 5 months and she enjoys every day. For her, knitting is a hobby that is also profitable, so she hopes to grow her business. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she has financial support because she has always been very responsible with her payments. She also likes being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible people and are very supportive. She is grateful to the people who will contribute to the loan that she is requesting and it will be very useful in the progress of her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy wool yarn at wholesale price.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of colors of wool yarn

loans.name: Choxbajan Group

texts.es: Doña Aura es casada, solo curso el cuarto grado primaria, tiene cuatro hijos de diferentes edades tres hombres y una mujer, el mayor de diez años y la mas pequeña de dos años, el esposo se dedica al comercio (Vendedor Ambulante) y ella colabora con algunos gastos familiares, y de educación ya que tres de sus hijos asisten a la escuela, ella se dedica a la Elaboración de canastas y que cuenta con gran experiencia, porque este ha sido su trabajo desde que era niña. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación personal y familiar y la ayuda de algunas vecinas, organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina MUJERES DE CHOXBAJAN, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes y también lleva el nombre del paraje ya que son originarias del mismo lugar. El grupo cuenta con 11 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales, elaboración de canastas, venta de artículos de consumo diario.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de materia prima, así generar más ingresos y de esa forma colaborar con el desarrollo de sus familias. Ya que una de las dificultades ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante y espera que su producción sea más grande y genere mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Aura is married and completed elementary school only through the fourth grade. She has four children of different ages, three sons and a daughter. The oldest is ten years old and the youngest is two years old. Her husband works as a traveling merchant and she helps with some of the family expenses, such as paying for the schooling of three of her children. Aura earns her living making baskets and has plenty of experience because she has done this type of work since she was a girl. Having enthusiasm, the desire to succeed personally and in her family life, and with the help of some neighbors, Aura was able to organize a group in order to request a loan.

This Communal Bank is called “Mujeres de Choxbajan” (Women of Choxbajan), a name that was chosen by all of the members since it contains the name of their hometown. The group consists of eleven women who are involved in different business activities such as raising animals, manufacturing baskets, and selling daily consumer products. This loan will be used to buy materials so that they can generate more income to help the development of their families. One of their difficulties has been the lack of capital, but now they can get ahead and expect to expand production as well as generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy materials

loans.name: El Samaritano 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Julia is the coordinator of her group Las Samaritanas 2 & 4 (The Samaritans). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 4 children. She says that her most difficult challenges is to raise her children to become adults with a good education. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying work.

Julia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 2 years, selling catalog products for a company. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying more cosmetics. She has plenty of orders for different perfumes and body lotions. She will use the profits to save and to provide some needs for her home.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she want to have a better income and she wants to help her husband. She also liked the program and the groups structure and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients in general. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics products (perfumes, body, hand and face lotion).

loans.name: Daniel Ezequiel

texts.es:
Daniel de 39 años,  el trabaja en su carro como taxista informal, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Fortín” y caracterizada por su pobreza y sus caminos de tierra.  

Comenzó a trabajar en su carro para tener dinero para sus 4 hijos de 8, 6, 2 años y uno de 2 meses, trabaja haciendo expresos a sus amigos y recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil. Ha venido trabajando desde las 07h000am hasta las 00h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar repuestos para su carro, en el futuro quiere tener una cooperativa de taxis para asegurar la vida económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel is 39 years old and works out of his car as an informal taxi driver. He lives in a periurban area of Guayaquil called Fortín, which is known for its poverty and the dirt roads.

Daniel began working out of his car so that he would have money to support his four children (ages 8, 6, 2, and 2 months). He works by acting as a personal courier for his friends and by traveling through the streets of Guayaquil. Daniel works every day from 7am to midnight.

With this loan, he wants to buy spare parts for his car. In the future, Daniel wants to have a taxi cooperative so that he can secure the finances of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts so that he can repair his car

loans.name: El Milagro Group

texts.es: Doña Isabel, tiene treinta y cuatro años D. edad, curso el quinto grado primaria, tiene tres hijos varones D. diferentes edades el mayor D. dieciocho años y el mas pequeño D. doce años, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y ella colabora con algunos gastos familiares y especialmente con los estudios D. sus hijos, ya que el mayor estudia el ultimo año D. su carrera D. Maestro D. Educación Primaria, se dedica al comercio, ella cuenta con una tienda D. consumo diario, ya que tiene 8 años D. experiencia en ésta actividad. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos D. superación, organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina EL MILAGRO, el nombre fue elegido por todas las integrantes. El grupo cuenta con 10 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza D. animales, servicios, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para incrementar los productos D. su negocio, así generar más ingresos, con lo cual espera mejorar las condicones D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Isabel is 34 years old and completed the fifth graD.. She has three sons of different ages. Her oldest son is 18 years old and her youngest one is 12 years old. Isabel’s husband works as a mason while she helps with a few family expenses, especially the education of her children. Her oldest son is in his final year before earning his degree in Elementary Education.

Isabel engages in traD. and has eight years of experience. She has a store where she sells daily consumer products. Having enthusiasm and the desire to succeed, she decided to organize a group in order to apply for a loan. The Communal Bank is called “El Milagro” (The Miracle), a name that was selected by all of the members. The group consists of ten women who are involved in different business activities which incluD. raising animals, providing services, and selling daily consumer products and traditional clothing.

This loan will be used to increase the inventory of products for her business so that she can generate more income. With this she hopes to improve the living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es: La Sra. Alcira, es una ama de casa que como muchas otras tuvo que buscarse la vida fuera de nuestras fronteras, esto debido a la mala situación económica de nuestro pais, al cabo de los años y con la ayuda mutua de su esposo Don Celso logro comprarse un pequeño terreno ubicado en la zona de Los Lotes de nuestra Ciudad y ademas de aquello logró juntar el capital necesario para la adquisición de un micro para el transporte público, por el cual recibe una renta diaria y necesaria para poder mantener a su familia. Actualmente y debido a sus inquietudes de madre ella se acerco a nuestras oficinas para poder solicitar un nuevo crédito, teniendo como destino la compra de mercadería en general (Azucar, Harina, Aceite, Arroz, Conservas, etc.) esto para poder llenar y surtir su puesto de abarrotes, el cual resientemente adquirio a 3 cuadras de su domicilio en el Mercadito Florida. Debido a la nueva actividad económica que Doña Alcira queria emprender, se le hizo una nueva investigación y se logro determinar la veracidad del mismo, motivo por el cual no se le negó dicho crédito, además de aquello cuenta con domicilio conocido en el Barrio 12 de Octubre, y a venido trabajando de forma satisfactoria con la institución desde hace un tiempo atrás, en la foto la Sra. Alcira se encuentra en compañia de su esposo y de su hijo.
texts.en:
Sra. Alcira is a homemaker who, like many others, has had to make a living outside of the country due to the bad economic situation. After a few years and with the help of her husband Don Celso, she was able to buy a small plot of land in the district of Los Lotes. In addition to her other achievements, Alcira was able to raise the necessary capital to acquire a minibus for providing public transportation. She rents out the vehicle on a daily and as-needed basis so that she can support her family.

Since she is concerned about her mother, Alcira has come to the Emprender offices to request a new loan so that she can buy general merchandise (sugar, flour, oil, rice, canned goods, etc.) so that she can stock the grocery stall that she recently acquired at the Florida Market, which is located three blocks from her house. Since Doña Alcira is undertaking a new business, an investigation was undertaken to determine the validity of the loan request to determine whether or not it should be approved. In addition, it has been verified that her home is located in the October 12th neighborhood since she already worked with Emprender some time ago in a successful manner. In the photograph, Sra. Alcira appears with her husband and son.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her grocery stand

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marco es un joven muy trabajador responsable que trabaja duro para mantener a su familia, el  se acerco a nuestras oficinas para poder solicitar un nuevo crédito, teniendo como destino la compra de mercadería en general (Azúcar, Harina, Aceite, Arroz, Conservas, etc.) esto para poder llenar y surtir su tienda de abarrotes, el cual recientemente  adquirió Debido a la nueva actividad económica y a venido trabajando de forma satisfactoria con la institución desde hace un tiempo atrás, su deseo del Sr. Marco es el de terminar sus estudios y poder asi mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Marco is a very hard-working, responsible young man who works hard to support his family. He came to our office to apply for a new loan, which will be used to buy general merchandise (sugar, flour, oil, rice, canned food, etc.) to fill and stock his grocery store, which he recently acquired thanks to the new economic activity. He has been working with our institution in a satisfactory way since some time ago. Sr. Marco's wish is to finish his studies and thus be able to improve the quality of life of his whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La Sra.  Flora  oriunda de Santa Cruz  actualmente vive en la zona de San Luis,  la Sra. cuenta con su casita propia tiene  hijos que actualmente están estudiando,  su negocio es la  elaboración de pan se dedica a esta actividad hace 4 años en la zona de San Luis.
Su Estado civil es soltera, de edad de 55 años ,madre soltera ,la Sra. es una buena clienta que esta muy agradecida con la institución por brindarle el apoyo para poder superarse como persona y en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Flora, a native of Santa Cruz, now lives in the San Luis zone. She has her own little house, and she has children who are now students. Her business is making bread. She has worked in this business for four years in the San Luis zone. Her civil state is single, she is 55 years old, and she is a single mother. She is a good client who is very thankful to the institution for offering her the support to aim ever higher as a person and in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and purchasing an oven

loans.name: Poderosa Luz

texts.es:
Poderosa de 52 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil. ella es vendedora de ropa y bebidas (en la foto aparece en la ventana de su casa donde vede bebidas). 

Una amiga la inscribió para que vendiera ropa por catalogo, poco a poco con la motivación de mantener a su hijo comenzó a vender también bebidas para tener otro ingresos adicional, con esto se estabilizo económicamente ya que no esta casada. Trabaja en horarios rotativos en la mañana vende ropa y en el resto del dia vende las bebidas.  

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa para que en un futuro pueda tener su tienda de ropa y tambien bebidas para un ingreso extra. En el futuro quiere tener un local.
texts.en:
Poderosa, who is 52, lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She sells clothing and beverages (in the photo, she appears in the window of her house, where she sells beverages). A friend signed her up to sell clothing through catalog sales, and little by little, with the motivation of supporting her son, she began to also sell drinks. With this activity she became economically stable even though she is not married. She splits her work day: in the morning she sells clothing, and for the rest of the day she sells beverages. With the loan, she wants to buy clothing so that in the future she can have her own shop with clothing and beverages as a source of extra income. In the future, she wants to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y el último de sus hijos de 28 años. Hace más de 15 años posee una pequeña librería bazar en la que vende todo tipo de útiles de escritorio y artículos para el hogar, de igual manera en el stand donde ella arrendó tiene  su propia oficina de servicios contables. Desde entonces Nancy ejerce de manera independiente su profesión, esto le ha servido para que ella y su esposo sean el sostén del hogar. Ahora sus hijos son personas independientes, se siente muy contenta y feliz  porque puede seguir generándose sus propias fuentes de ingreso, a pesar que tiene mucha competencia. Para el futuro quiere tener más mercadería disponible. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de papel de diferentes calidades y medidas.
texts.en:
Nancy is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and her youngest child, who is 28 years old. For more than 15 years, she has had a small stationary store where she sells all kinds of stationary supplies and other items for the home. She has her own accounting services office in the same location as her store. Nancy works independently and this has helped her and her husband to support their family. Now that her children are economically independent from her, she is very happy because she can continue generating her own sources of income, even though she has a lot of competition. For the future, she wants to have more merchandise available. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she has financial support, because she has always been very responsible with her payments. She also likes being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible people and very supportive. She is grateful to the people who will contribute to the loan that she is requesting and it will be very useful to her in progressing with her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy paper in different qualities and sizes.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper in different qualities

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is 29 years old with three children aged 2, 5, and 7 years old. He looks after his family and lives with other four dependents. He owns his home and his family goal is to educate his children. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. 

He is into the motorcycle transport business and has been doing it for three years. He started by working for someone and then later bought his own motorcycle. He faces challenges of accidents and bad roads. He hopes in future that his business will grow into a big transport business. He wants the loan as a top-up to buy a car for his transport business.

loans.use: Buying a car for his transport business.

loans.name: Alberto Victoriano

texts.es:
Alberto de 50 años, el es taxista en las calles de Guayaquil, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Paraíso” lugar caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Por la falta de oportunidades el tenia que alquilar un carro para ser taxista informal pero con esfuerzo y todos sus ahorros después de un tiempo compro su propio taxi, poco a poco lo ha venido pagando. Trabaja todos los días y solo descansa en la hora del almuerzo el objetivo de el es comprar otro carro.

Quiere el préstamo para reparar el carro que le ha venido causando problemas al manejar, en el futuro quiere comprar otro taxi.
texts.en:
Alberto is 50 years old. He is a taxi driver in the streets of Guayaquil. He lives in a neighborhood called “Paraíso” (Paradise) in the outskirts Guayaquil. It is an area characterized by dirt roads. Because of a lack of opportunities, he had to rent a car to be an informal taxi driver. However, with hard work and all his savings, after some time he was able to purchase his own taxi. Little by little, he has been paying it off. He works everyday and is only off work during the lunch hour. His objective is to purchase another car. He wants the loan to repair his car, which lately has been causing him problems when he drives it. In the future, he wants to buy another taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair

loans.name: Edinansi

texts.en:
Edinansi is 30 years old. She's a single mother to two children aged 5 and 10 years. She takes care of her family and lives with other three dependents. She lives in a rented home and her family goal is to educate her children so that they will have a bright future. Her place of residence is Masindi, Uganda.

She is into the retail business and has been doing it for six years. She started with little stock but now it has grown considerably. She faces a challenge of paying rent which is ever on the increase and in future she expects her business to grow into a big retail shop. She wants the loan for purchasing sugar, soap, rice, and other domestic items for selling in her shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap, rice, and domestic items for her shop

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 37 years old, married with six children aged 8 to 18 years old. Her spouse is a teacher and her family responsibility is to look after her family. She has no other dependents. She lives in a rented home in Masindi, Uganda. She has a bar business and has been doing that for eight years.

She started with a small bar but now it’s big with a pool table and entertainment. She has no hardship in her business and she expects it to grow into a guest house. She wants the loan to buy a pool table for her pub business.

loans.use: To buy a pool table for her pub

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 36 años, comparte su vida en compañía de su hijo, juntos viven en casa de un familiar. El trabajo al que se dedica es la preparación de pasteles, los cuales son vendidos en su pequeña pastelería, además trabaja en una panadería en donde le da la facilidad de hornear los pasteles que ella misma prepara. Disfruta su trabajo cada día, ya que le encanta elaborar pasteles y considera que es un trabajo donde puede ejecutar todo su potencial y habilidad en la  decoración, además que le es rentable y gratificante. Espera para el futuro mejorar sus ventas. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de harina y bandejas para la elaboración de pasteles.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old and shares her life with her son and they live together in a family home. She makes cakes, which she sells from her small cake shop. She also works in a bakery, where she is able to bake her cakes. She enjoys her work each day because she likes making cakes and she considers this a job where she can use all of her potential and decorating ability. It is also profitable and gratifying. She hopes to be able to increase her sales in the future. This will be her fourth loan through MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial backing, since she has always shown responsibility with her payments. She also likes being a part of a communal group, because the people there are very united and responsible. She is grateful to those who have managed this loan and it will be very useful toward the progress of her business. She will use the money from this loan to invest in flour and trays so that she can bake cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flour and trays

loans.name: Ramula

texts.en:
Ramula is a 35-year-old lady and single mother to three children aged 10, 15, and 17 years old. She is the sole provider for her family and she has three other dependents. She lives in her own home in Masindi, Uganda.

She is a fishmonger and has been doing this for 14 years. She started with a small capital now it has grown to to higher levels. She faces a hardship of fishing laws which some times restrict her sales. She expects her business to grow in future and even to start supplying other markets. She wants the loan to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: G. S Maria Elena Cuadra Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Maria Elena Cuadra está integrado por 3 personas que se conocen desde hace muchos años atrás, Las señoras son personas que tienen sus propios negocios, cada una tiene amplia experiencia en la administración de su negocio, a continuación se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan. Ana Fabiola se dedica a la venta de piñatas y adornos, ella inicio por una amiga que le enseño y más tarde ella decide establecer su propio negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación, con las ganancias que obtiene mantiene a su familia y para comprar utilidades necesarias motivo por el cual está solicitando el crédito. La Señora Reyna se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, ella tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en la administración del mismo. Ella tiene 2 hijos junto a su esposo los cuales tres dependen del matrimonio a los cuales les brindan todos los gastos de alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación. Y la última integrante del grupo es Yadira Del Carmen que se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que juntas se han unido para realizar financiamientos y comprar lo necesario para su negocio.
texts.en:
The group named Solidario Maria Elena Cuadra is made up of 3 women who have known each other for many years. The women each have their own business, and each one has extensive experience managing her business. Following below is more detailed information on the different work that each of them do. Ana Fabiola makes her living selling piñatas (decorative containers hung up during festivities and hit with a stick to release candy from inside) and decorations. She was introduced to the work by a friend, who taught it to her, and later she decided to establish her own business in the house where she is living. With the profits that she earns she supports her family and purchases the necessary tools for her business, which is the reason she is requesting the loan. Señora Reyna makes her living selling general merchandise. She has over 5 years experience managing her business. She has 2 dependent children and a husband. They provide their children with food, clothing, health care and education. And the last member of the group is Yadira Del Carmen, who also makes her living selling general merchandise. These women have come together to obtain financing and purchase the necessary goods for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 34-year-old lady, married with three children aged 2, 4, and 11 years old. She looks after her family and pays school fees for her children. She lives in her own house with 6 other dependents and her family goal is to educate her children.

She lives in Masindi, Uganda and her business is hiring out tents and chairs and doing outside catering. She has been in this business for 8 years and she started it with 80 chairs now she has 250 chairs with 2 tents. The challenge she has is that people tend to break her chairs and don’t replace them. In future she expects to be a prominent service provider in her area. She wants the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for the children.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 52 años, convive con el menor de sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 2 años posee una tienda de comestibles, ubicada dentro de su domicilio, además sus hijos la apoyan en la atención, ofreciendo a su clientela variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Es así que todas las mañanas trabaja atendiendo a sus clientes, los días jueves sale en busca de más mercadería, como: carne, queso y  algunos productos que son cosechados en la zona rural, por lo que se limita a venderlos los sábados de manera ambulante. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que  puede ver sus ganancias de manera diaria, es por ello que desea incrementar su capital. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gasificadas, arroz y azúcar por sacos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 52 years old and lives with the youngest of her four children in a home of her own. For the past two years she has had a grocery store located within her home, and offers primary need products. Her children help her and she attends to customers every morning. On Wednesdays she goes out in search of merchandise such as meat, cheese, and some harvested products within the rural zone. She sells them on foot every Saturday. What she enjoys most about her work is that she is able to see her earnings daily. This is why she wants to increase her working capital. This will be her fifth loan through MFP she’s very happy to know that she has financial backing. She is also glad to be part of a communal bank, because its members are very united and responsible.
