She appreciates the people who manage this loan and it has been very helpful to the progress of her business. She will use the money from this loan to buy carbonated drinks, and sacks of rice, and sugar to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Byron Felipe

texts.es:
Byron de 23 años, el es conductor de una tricimoto (es una moto con un puesto atas de pasajeros), vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil.    

Por la falta de oportunidades laborable comenzó a vender empanadas, tortillas y comida rápida pero como no tenia mucho ingresos para mantener a su hijo y esposa decidió invertir sus ahorros en una moto y en una base para hacer asientos. En Ecuador es muy común la tricimoto porque es un medio de transporte ágil y barato. Byron trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 22h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pernos, y herramientas para su moto en el futuro quiere tener su casa propia y tener un negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Byron is 23 years old, he drives a "tricimoto" (a motorbike with a seat for passengers), he lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil. Because of a shortage of job opportunities he started to sell empanadas, tortillas and fast food but as he did not have a lot of income to support his son and wife he decided to invest his savings in a motorbike and a base for making seats. In Ecuador the "tricimoto" is very common because it is a means of agile and cheap transport. Byron works from 05h00am until 22h00pm. With the loan he wants to buy bolts, and tools for his motorbike. In the future he wants to have his own home and have a food business.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Pilar is the coordinator of her group, Unidos por el progreso 2 & 3 (unite to progress). She makes her home here in a simple structure with 3 children and her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a successful business.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to cook an go to the church.

Pilar is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for more than 5 years, starting with a small amount of money that she saved to start a business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying charcoal, baked foods and candies. She will use the profits to help her children, to save and finish building her house and she is planing to finish her high school studies.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because, she says "I really like what Esperanza offers". Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients in general. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and other items.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es: Doña Antonia Salomé es casada, de treinta y cuatro años de edad, curso el cuarto grado primaria, tiene cuatro hijos de diferentes edades el mayor de quince años y la mas pequeña de seis años, el esposo se dedica a la Artesanía y ella colabora con algunos gastos familiares y educativos, se dedica de igual manera a la artesanía (Confección de Pantalones), cuenta con 14 años de experiencia en ésta actividad, ya que esta actividad realizaba su esposo y ella también se incorporó a esta actividad. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación y la ayuda de unas primas y vecinas  organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina LAS MARGARITAS, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes, ya que en el lugar estas flores son muy conocidas. El grupo cuenta con 10 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza de animales, confección de pantalones, elaboración de cortes típicos, venta de alimentos y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de tela, y de esa forma incrementar su negocio y así generar más ingresos y espera que su negocio sea más grande y pueda genere mas ingresos para su desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Ms. Antonia Salomé is 34 years old, married, and studied through the fourth grade of primary school. She has four children of different ages. The oldest is 15 years old and the youngest is six years old. Her husband is a craft maker and she contributes to some of the family's household and education expenses. Like her husband, she makes artisanal crafts (she makes pants). She has 14 years of experience in this type of work, as her husband did this work and she started to as well. She tells with enthusiasm about her desire to get ahead, and with the help of some of her cousins and neighbors, they organized a group to be able to apply for a loan. The Communal Bank is called "Las Margaritas" ("The Daisies"). The name was chosen by all of the members because in their area, these flowers are very well known. The group has 10 members, all women, who work in various activities, including: animal husbandry, pants-making, making traditional skirts, and selling food and typical clothing. Ms. Antonia will use the loan to buy fabric, and in this way she will grow her business and thereby generate more income. She hopes that her business will get bigger and that she will be able to create more income for her personal and familial development.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric for making pants

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Simeona; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 Hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio minorista; Ella se dedica a vender verduras  desde hace 20 años, ella estudio la primaria completa y ahora trabaja vendiendo verduras en el mercado de Santa Rosa en la sección verduras, La socia necesita capital para comprar por mayor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de verduras al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Mi Perú” comnumal bank. The bank is located in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco. The member is Simeona; she is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with sales. She has been selling vegetable for 20 years. She finished primary school and she now works selling vegetables in the market of Santa Rosa, in the vegetable section. She needs capital to buy wholesale. She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables at wholesale price. She is grateful to the people who are part of her dream through this program. She promises to make her payments in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale price

loans.name: Constantino

texts.es: Constantino tiene 47 años, convive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, actividad que le ayuda para sobrevivir en caso de escasez económica, sin embargo su trabajo se intensifica más en la agricultura, sembrando y cosechando papa. Por otro lado tuvo riesgos de perdida, por tal motivo siembra productos alternativos como la oca y la cebada, alimentos que también guarda para la despensa de la familia. Afirma que le gusta su trabajo, y se siente contenta ya que sus hijos y su esposa lo apoyan en el trabajo, pero cuando se requiere de mucho esfuerzo contrata a peones para que le ayuden a terminar el trabajo. Para el futuro desea tener más extensiones de terreno y  comprar cabezas de animal ovino. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas de papa.
texts.en:
Constantino is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three children in their own home. He’s been farming and raising livestock for more than 20 years. This helps him to survive in times of financial scarcity. Never the less, his farming work is more intense; planting and harvesting potatoes. He lost money in his other work, so he’s been planting alternative crops, such as ocra (a type of tuber) and barley. He reserves some to feed his family. He tells us that he likes his work and feels happy that his children and wife support him in his labors, but he also has to hire field hands when the work requires more effort. He hopes to have more extensions to his land in the future and wants to buy heads of cattle. This will be his first loan through MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial backing. He also likes being a part of a communal group, because its members are responsible, united people. He is also grateful to the generous people who will make this loan possible. It will be very helpful to his business. He will use the money from this loan to invest in sacs of potato seed and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Potato seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es: Nemesio tiene 42 años, vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niño aprendió a las tareas del campo, es así que siembra papa y maíz principalmente, su esposa y sus hijos son el apoyo principal, y cada cierto tiempo verifican constantemente que los cultivos estén libres de plaga de insectos, pero cuando el trabajo es mas intenso, contrata el servicio de peones. Afirma que le agrada bastante trabajar en el campo porque lo realiza de manera independiente y sin presiones. Aunque su labor es sacrificada  es compensada cuando llega a vender todo lo cosechado, es por esta razón que desea adquirir más terrenos y aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita por que sabe que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima temporada de siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Nemesio is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own home. He learned to farm when he was a boy and now raises mainly potatoes and corn. His wife and children help him and periodically check the crops to make sure that they are free of insects and disease. When the requirement for labor increases, he hires additional field hands. He tells us that he enjoys working in the fields very much, because he does it independently and with no pressure. Even though it’s hard work, it’s rewarded when he sells his harvest. This is why he wants to acquire more land and increase his number of animals. This will be his first loan through MFP and he’s very happy to know that he has financial backing. He is also glad to be part of a communal bank, because its members are very united and responsible. He appreciates the people who manage this loan and it has been very helpful to the progress of his business. He will use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer for his next potato planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Fernando; el tiene 42  años de edad y es viudo  tiene 2 Hijos; El socio es natural de Anta y alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio minorista,  ella vende cochinilla (sirve para usar en el teñido de lanas); desde hace 14 años. El socio es solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cochinilla para la venta.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This gentleman is part of the “Mi Peru” communal bank, located in the Santiago district of the Cusco province and department. Fernando is 42 years old and is a widower with two children. He is originally from Anta and has been working in his small business daily; selling cochinilla (an insect used for dying wool) for 14 years. He is asking for this loan so that he can invest in cochinilla for resale. He is grateful to those who are helping him fulfill his dreams through this medium and is committed to making his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Henry Gregoric

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Henry; el tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente  tiene 2 Hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio minorista, El socio se dedica a la venta de madera;  El socio es solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la veta.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Mi Perú” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco. The member is Henry. He is 34 years old, lives with his partner, and has 2 children. He alternates his daily activities with sales. He sells wood. He is requesting the loan to invest in merchandise. He is grateful to the people who are part of his dream through this program. He promises to make his payments in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for resale

loans.name: Hector Horacio

texts.es:
Héctor de 30 años,  vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), su esposa trabaja en una camaronera, tienen una casa de cemento y tablas. 

El esta trabajando en una empresa llamada Promariscos se dedica a vender toda clase de mariscos, el es bodeguero se encarga de empacar todos los paquetes que van a las tiendas, trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 20h00pm. 

Su casa aun no la tiene construida a su totalidad por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar cemento, bloques y arena. En el futuro quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y tener su propio negocio de mariscos.
texts.en:
Hector is 30 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran ( suburban area with a degrading ecology at the outskirts of Guayaquil), his wife works in the shrimping business and they have a house made of cement and boards. He is working at a factory that sells all kinds of seafood, called Promariscos. He works in the warehouse where he is in charge of filling packages before they are sent out to stores. He works from 8AM to 8PM. He has yet to complete the building of his house which is why he wants the loan, in order to buy cement, cement blocks, and sand. In the future he would like to improve the quality of life for his family and own a seafood business.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, cement blocks, sand

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Desde que era niño, estuvo ligado a las tareas agrícolas, que es ahora parte de su herencia que le dejaron sus padres. Actualmente trabaja de manera independiente en el cultivo de sus terrenos  que con la ayuda de su esposa e hijo, siembra papa, maíz, arveja y cebada. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo  es que  puede disponer de los productos que cosecha, además que el campo le ofrece la tranquilidad que necesita, pues este trabajo es tan sacrificado y agotador. En adelante desea tener más extensiones de terreno y comprar más animales. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para la siguiente campaña.
texts.en:
Manuel is 49 year old and lives with his wife and son in their own home. He has been strapped to farming since he was a boy and it has become part of the inheritance that his parents left him. He works independently on his own land, and with his wife’s help raises potatoes, corn, peas, and barley. What he enjoys most about his work is that he is able to use the products that he harvests. Aside from that, the fields provide a tranquility that he needs because this work is exhausting and requires a lot of sacrifice. In the future he wants to have more extensions to his land and buy more animals. This will be his first loan through MFP and he’s very happy to know that he has financial backing. He is also glad to be part of a communal bank, because its members are very united and responsible. He appreciates the people who manage this loan and it has been very helpful to the progress of his business. He will use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer for his next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es madre soltera y es natural de Apurimac,  ella tiene 1 hijo; la socia es enfermera de proefesión y alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, la socia de vez en cuando trae ropa de la ciudad de Lima y los vende a pedido, ella también suele traer zapatos calados como 4 pares a lo mucho y si le piden sus compañeras de trabajo ella envía el dinero y le envían cuando ella no puede viajar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la mercadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Mi Perú” comnumal bank. The bank is located in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco. The member is Victoria. She is 42 years old, is a single mother, and is originally from Apurimac. She has one son. She is a nurse by profession and alternates her activities with sales. She occasionally brings clothing from the city of Lima and sells it to people who have requested it. She also brings sandals, usually 4 pairs at the most. If her work companions request it of her, she also sends the money [for the clothing or sandals to her contacts in Lima] and they send [the merchandise] to her when she can’t travel. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise. She is grateful to the people who are part of her dream through this program. She promises to make her payments in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and sandals

loans.name: Mujeres De Los Riscos Group

texts.es:
Doña María Victoria S. A., es casada, tiene 4 hijos, es una persona que se ha dedicado a la elaboración D. pan ya que a través D. este trabajo ella a superado a si mismo a podido mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos D. su hogar, por tal razón ella tomo la idea D. formar un grupo D. señoras, para que ellas puedan superar también este grupo está conformado por trece personas,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes actividades las que mencionamos como crianza D. animales, venta D. frutas y verduras, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario.

Las integrantes del grupo decidieron solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia, las integrantes del Banco Comunal, Mujeres D. Los Riscos, del Barrio Patzite  Momostenango.
texts.en:
María Victoria S. A. is married and has 4 children. She is a person who has dedicated her time to making bread, and through this work she has had economic success and has been able to support her family and cover the household expenses. Along these lines, she had the idea to form a group of women so that they could also succeed. This group is comprised of 13 people, women who work in different areas, including raising animals, selling fruit and selling products that are basic necessities. The members of the group decided to request a loan from ASDIR to improve the living conditions of themselves and their families. The name of this communal bank is "Mujeres D. Los Riscos," and they are from the Patzite neighborhood of Momostenango.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Formando Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal“Formando un Futuro” integrada por 10 emprendedoras socias y un socio que gracias a sus esfuerzos dedicación y sacrificio logran sacar a delante a sus familias y asi darles una mejor calida D. vida.
   Ellas vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO–PROSPERIDAD hace un año y medio.Como es el caso D. L. Sra. Paulina(L. señora que posa D. pie en L. foto) que hace muchos años a tras vivía una casa prefabricada.
        En L. actualidad Paulina que se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes en un mercado cerca a su casa y con el apoyo D. su esposo que también trabaja  en una fábrica lograron construir una humilD. casa D. material noble gracias a los ahorros y pequeñas ganancias que elL. y su esposo tenían; pero aun todavía lo falta techar y terminar con algunos acabados interiores como terminar a tarrajear las paredes,colocar mayólicas a los baños  y unas puertas mas seguras.
               Paulina sueña con tener su casa terminada  para trasladar su negocio a su propia casa y dar una mayor comodidad para sus 3 pequeños hijos que están estudiando porque cuando sale a trabajar L. mayor D. sus hijas es quien se hace cargo D. sus hermanos pero gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio su sueño pronto se hara realidad.
   Paulina se siente satisfecha por los logros alcanzados hasta ahora; ElL. cuenta que nada D. eso  hubiese sido posible sin L. confianza que le dio EDAPROSPO al otorgarlo sus tres préstamos en estos 18 meses que viene trabajando.
   El reciente préstamo lo utilizara  en implementar aun mucho más su negocio comprando todo lo necesario para tener un buen surtido en su tienda.
texts.en:
The "Formando un Futuro" (Making a Future) community bank consists of 10 women and one man who--thanks to their effort, dedication, and sacrifice--have been able to move forward and give their families a better quality of life. They have been working with the EDAPROSPO–PROSPERIDAD microfinance partner for a year and a half. Such is the case with Mrs. Paulina (the woman standing up in the photo), who used to live in a prefabricated house for many years. Today, Paulina sells groceries at a market near her house; with the help of her husband, who works in a factory, she was able to build a humble house of good material using their savings. But the house still lacks a roof and needs some finishing, such as coating the walls with cement, putting tiles in the bathrooms, and installing safer doors. Paulina wants to finish her house so that she can move her business there and so that she can make life more comfortable for her 3 small children, who are students. At the moment, her eldest daughter takes care of the others while she is at work. Thanks to her hard work and sacrifice, her wish will soon be a reality. Paulina is satisfied with her achievements to date. She tells us that none of this would have been possible without EDAPROSPO's support; they have given her three loans over the past 18 months. She will use this loan to expand her business, buying what she needs to build up a good supply of products in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Sonia María

texts.es:
La Señora Sonia María E. es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive en el sector Las Caleras en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió,  reconocida por ser la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador.  Cuenca es una ciudad encantadora por sus iglesias, su parque histórico y su gente.
 
Doña Sonia María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de su hogar y también a la venta de productos YANBAL, lleva 9 años en este negocio, se dedica a la venta  en su tiempo libre. Lleva 12 años trabajando con su bankito, es una de las socias fundadoras y  nos comenta que los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en el incremento de su negocio, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de productos YANBAL.

La Señora. Sonia tiene 37 años,  es casada, y tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 13 años de edad, su hija mayor estudia en la universidad y su hijo menor en el colegio, su esposo es chofer y maneja su propio taxi, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Su  sueño es incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia María E. is a member of the Las Caleras Communal Bank. She lives in the Las Caleras area of the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate, and it is know for being the third most important city in Ecuador. Cuenca is a charming city because of its churches, its historical park, and its people. Sonia María devotes herself to the household chores, and she also sells Yanbal products. She has been in this business for nine years. She sells during her free time. She has been working with her communal bank for 12 years. She is one of the founding members, and she tells us that the loans have been very helpful in increasing her business. She will use the new loan from the Fundación Espoir to buy Yanbal products. Sonia is 37 years old, and she is married. She has two children, ages 19 and 13. Her oldest daughter is attending the university. Her youngest child goes to school. Her husband is a driver, and he drives his own taxi. The house where they live is their own. Her dream is to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy creams, perfumes, jewelry, and Yanbal cosmetics

loans.name: Pedro Hernan

texts.es: El Sr. B. C. Pedro Hernan vive en el distrito de Tate junto a su esposa. Trabaja como obrero de campo en el fundo El Pedregal desde hace 10 años. Cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para terminar de realizar acabados a su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Su sueño segun nos comenta es poder darle a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. B. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Pedro Hernan B. C. lives with his wife in the Tate district. He has been a field worker for the El Pedregal farm for ten years. He has his own home, and he is making the final touches. He is requesting a loan to complete the final touches on his house. He wants to do this to be able to give his family a better quality of life. His dream, as he tells us, is to be able to give his wife a better quality of life. Mr. B. is grateful for the support that we are able to give him through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Cerila

texts.es: Cerila tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura desD. hace 20 años, junto con sus hijos y su esposo la apoya en esta actividad. Sin embargo hay ocasiones en que su esposo tiene que ir a trabajar en una minería, por lo que solo debe poner mano dura, sembrando sola papa, maíz, cebada y habas, que una vez cosechadas lo lleva a vender D. manera directa a los mercados mayorista. D. esta manera obtiene ganancias que le permiten sostener a su familia. Afirma que le gusta trabajar en la agricultura porque le permite tener buena cantidad D. alimentos en su almacén y aunque el trabajo es muy intenso y esforzado siempre  mantiene su optimismo con este trabajo es por esta razón que se proyecta  para el futuro mejorar sus futuras cosechas y adquiriendo más animales. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono y semillas D. papa, para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Cerila is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and four children in their own house. She has been working in agriculture for the past twenty years. She has the assistance of her children and husband in her business. Never the less, there are times when her husband has to go to work in the mines. At this time she has to work extra hard planting potatoes, corn, barley and lima beans. When these items are harvested she brings them to the wholesale market to sell. In this way she is able to make money to support her family. She likes to work in agriculture because it allows her to have a good amount of food in her small grocery market. Even though the work is very intense and difficult, she is always optimistic. In the future she would like to improve her harvests and acquire more animals. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support. She has always been responsible with her payments. Also she is thankful to be part of the communal group because the members are responsible and supportive. She is thankful for those people that will be managing the loan that she is requesting. They have been very useful by helping her improve her business. With the loan money that she is requesting, she will buy sacks of fertilizer and potato seed in order to continue growing crops.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy sacks of fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María Mercedes O. es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive en el sector Las Caleras en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió,   es la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador. Cuenca es una ciudad encantadora por sus iglesias, su parque histórico, su cultura y su gente.
 
La Señora. María Mercedes tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 20 y 18 años de edad, su hijo mayor es casado y vive independientemente, su hijo de 20 años se dedica a trabajar y estudia en la universidad, su hija de 18 años trabaja y estudia a distancia en la universidad, su esposo es empleado privado.

Doña María se dedica a la preparación de viandas (loncheras), lleva 3 años en este negocio, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes de 9 a.m. a 4 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de animales domésticos como: cuys, conejos, pollos, los pollos son tanto para su negocio como para su consumo.

Lleva 10 años trabajando en su bankito, nos comenta que los créditos le benefician mucho en su negocio, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la preparación de sus viandas (loncheras), su gran sueño es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
María Mercedes O. is a member of the Las Caleras Communal Bank. She lives in the Las Caleras area of the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate, and it is know for being the third most important city in Ecuador. Cuenca is a charming city because of its churches, its historical park, and its people. María Mercedes is 42 years old and married. She has three children, ages 22, 20, and 18. Her oldest child is married and lives independently. Her 20 year old son works and attends the university. Her 18 year old daughter works and studies through distance learning in the university. Her husband is a private employee. María devotes herself to preparing food (lunches). She has been in this business for three years. Her work schedule is Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. until 4 p.m. She also raises domestic animals like guinea pigs, rabbits, and chickens. The chickens are as much for her business as for personal consumption. She has been working with her communal bank for ten years. She tells us the loans have been a big help to her business. She will use the new loan from the Fundación Espoir to buy food to make the lunches. Her big dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, rice, potatoes, oil, and eggs, etc.

loans.name: Laura Del Rosario

texts.es:
Laura de 33 años, ella vende productos de uso personas en una furgoneta recorriendo todo Guayaquil, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Trabaja hace 5 años con su furgoneta con la compañía de su esposo venden papel higiénico, jabón, ropa (es un local de ambulantes). Recorren toda la ciudad de Guayaquil, por días se quedan estacionados hasta vender toda su mercadería. Trabajan desde las 06h00am hasta las 18h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mercadería como papel, jabón, shampoo para su negocio ambulante. En el futuro quiere tener ya un local, y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Laura is 33 years old. She sells personal hygiene products in a van all around Guayaquil. She lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil in an area where most of the inhabitants are informal traders. For the last five years, she and her husband have worked together in the van, selling toilet paper, soap, and clothing (it is an area with itinerants). They cover the whole city of Guayaqui;; they stay parked for days until they sell all their merchandise. They work from 6 am to 6 pm. With this loan, they want to buy merchandise, such as toilet paper, soap, and shampoo for their traveling trade. In the future, they hope to have a permanent place and to improve their house.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap, shampoo, toilet paper for their business

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora María Rosario P. es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive en el sector Las Caleras en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, reconocida por ser la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador, Cuenca es una ciudad encantadora por sus iglesias y su parque histórico.
 
Doña María Rosario tiene 38 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 4 hijos de 18, 17, 13, 7, años de edad, sus hija de 18 años estudia en la universidad, sus hijos de 17 y 13 años estudian en el colegio y su hijo de 7 años está en la escuela, su esposo labora como guardia de  seguridad, la casa en la que habitan no es de su propiedad por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora María trabaja en una fábrica donde se dedica a lijar los muebles, lleva 3 años y medio en este trabajo y su horario es de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m. Los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de productos AVON,  lleva 2 años en este negocio y sus clientas son  sus compañeras de trabajo.

Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 2 años y nos comenta que los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos AVON.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María Rosario P. is a member of the Las Caleras Communal Bank. She lives in the Las Caleras area of the city of Cuenca. This city with a cold climate is recognized as being the third most important city in Ecuador. Cuenca is a charming city because of its churches and its historical park. María Rosario is 38 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage. She has four children, ages 18, 17, 13, and 7. Her 18 year old daughter goes to the university. Her 17 and 13 year old children go to high school, and the 7 year old goes to elementary school. Her husband works as a security guard. The house where they live is not their own; they rent it. María works in a factory that sands furniture. She has been doing this work for three and a half years. Her schedule is from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. On the week-ends she sells Avon products. She has been in this business for two years. Her customers are her work colleagues. She has been in her communal bank for two years. She tells us that the loans had helped her a lot in her business. She will use the new loan from the Fundación Espoir to buy more Avon products. Her dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy creams, perfumes, jewelry, and Avon cosmetics

loans.name: Tomas Dionisio

texts.es: Tomas tiene un molino ubicado en ojochal una comunidad en donde él vive. Este es su séptimo crédito con la Fundación. Para Tomas su negocio es bien importante, porque le significan los ingresos de su hogar, por eso lo cuida mucho y sus créditos que han aplicado a su actividad, logrando aumentar su capital de trabajo y gradualmente ha visto sus utilidades reflejadas en mejoras para su hogar. Por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes recurren a su local ya que ofrece un buen servicio,  pues Tomas está allí desde las 7 de la mañana y cierra su negocio a las 5 de la tarde. Este financiamiento es para la compra de bandas, repuestos eléctricos para el molino y accesorio.
texts.en:
Tomas has a mill located in Ojochal, the community where he lives. This is his seventh loan with the foundation. For Tomas his business is pretty important because it provides the income for his home. For this reason he takes good care of it and the loans that have allowed his activity. He's managed to expand his working capital and gradually he's seen the profits reflected in the improvements of his home. The majority of his customers return to his shop because he offers a good service. Tomas is there from 7 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon. This loan is for the purchase of bands and spare electrical parts and accessories for the mill.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juan Oswaldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es él Sr. Juan;  el tiene 41 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo;  es natural de Lima y se dedica al comercio minorista, el socio vende todo tipo de productos como por ejemplo, vino, néctar de frutas, yogur y todo lo relacionado a la agro industria desde hace 7 años. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en diferentes productos.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Mi Perú (My Peru). The bank is located in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco.

The client is Mr. Juan. He is 41 years old, has a live-in partner, and has a son. He is originally from Lima and he works in the retail business. He sells all types of products – for example, wine, fruit nectar, yogurt, and anything related to the agricultural industry. He has been in this business for the past 7 years. He is requesting this loan to invest in different products.

Juan is grateful for those who are part of this dream and he promises to make his payments according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in different products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 32 años, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su esposo y sus 2 queridos hijos. Para ella es importante salir adelante con su familia, es por ello que vende salchichas y papas fritas en su stand móvil que recorre las diversas calles, ubicando frente a la puesta de algún colegio. Algunas madres de familia le compran este agradable platillo a precios muy módicos que oferta. Durante estos 2 años ha logrado ganar experiencia, además parte favorable de su trabajo es que lo realiza a medio tiempo, de esa manera no descuida de sus hijos. Espera en adelante comprar su terreno y construir su casa, para mejorar su condición de vida y la de sus hijos. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, para renovar otros créditos, ya que los considera de gran ayuda para su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar un balón de gas y materiales que le ayuden a almacenar las papas ya picadas y listas para  freír.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old and lives in her parents’ house, together with her husband and 2 dear children. For her, it is important to get ahead with her family, which is why she sells hot dogs and French fries at her mobile stand with which she travels the different streets, locating herself in front of a school. Some family mothers buy this enjoyable dish from her at the very reasonable prices that she offers. During these 2 years she has been able to gain experience. In addition, a nice part of her job is that she does it part-time, so she does not neglect her children. In the future, she hopes to purchase land and build her house to improve her living conditions and those of her children.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make all of her payments on time to receive other loans, since she considers them to be of great help for her business. With the loan requested, she plans to purchase a gas tank and materials to help her store the potatoes that are already chopped and ready to be fried.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A gas tank and materials to help her store the potatoes that are already chopped

loans.name: Yudy

texts.es:
Yudy es socio del Banco Comunal Delfín, Yusy es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años, Yudy tiene un mototaxi con el cual realiza trasporte de pasajeros, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Yudy es albañil y realiza trabajados de construcción por contrata. Los sueños de Yudy son mejorar su negocio, brindar una buena educación a su hijo y comprar un carro para trabajar.
Yudy solicita un crédito de 2000 soles para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi y la compra del seguro.
texts.en:
Yudy is a member of the communal bank Delfín. He lives with his partner and has a 3-year-old son. Yudy has a moto-taxi with which he transports passengers everyday. He's also a bricklayer and does construction work on contract. Yudy's dreams are to improve his business, provide a good education for his son, and buy a car for work. He's requesting a loan of 2,000 soles ($725) for the maintenance of his moto-taxi and the purchase of insurance.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of moto-taxi and purchase of insurance

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es casada y tiene 7 hijos, D. los cuales 1 vive con ella, Sabina compra cereales variados D. las ferias D. la región en donD. venD. frutas, luego los procesa, tiene un molino en su casa en donD. procesa los cereales, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Sabina tiene el deseo D. comprar otro molino moderno para mejorar su negocio.
Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín y solicita un crédito D. 1000 soles para la compra D. cebada y trigo.
texts.en:
Sabina is married and has 7 children, one of whom lives with her. Sabina buys various types of cereals from the street markets of the region where she sells fruit. She has a mill in her house where she processes the cereals and then sells them in the markets of Ayacucho. She wants to buy a modern mill to improve her business. Sabina is a member of the communal bank Delfín and she's requesting a loan of 1,000 soles ($375) for the purchase of barley and wheat.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of barely and wheat

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel de 47 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Empezó  por la necesidad de adquirir ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia. Por lo que no ha sido fácil obtener nuevos clientes, pero Reyna siempre se las ingenia para atraerlos. Ahora trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde todos los días. Pues ella tiene 3 hijos menores edad a su cargo y por los que cuidar. Ella se siente muy alegre con este financiamiento pues es su primer crédito y espera tener éxito quiere comprar con el préstamo pantalones, vestidos, trajes y pantalones. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda propia en donde pueda ofertar una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel, age 47, sells used clothes. She started because she needed income and to get her family ahead. It has not been easy to get new customers. But, Reyna always thinks of a way to attract them. She now works from seven in the morning until six in the evening everyday. She has three minor children under her care. She is very happy about this loan. It is her first loan, and she hopes to have success. She wants to use the loan to buy dresses, suits, and pants. In the future she wants to have her own store where she can sell a great variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo pequeño de 1 año, de profesión trabajadora social, Yovana junto a su esposo que es Ingeniero Civil de profesión tienen un empresa de proyectos y capacitación, servicios que brindar a diferentes instituciones.
Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín y necesita un préstamo de 900 soles para realizar parte de pago de una impresora.
Los sueños de Yovana son que su familia se realice, su hijo tenga una buena formación y su empresa sea reconocida a nivel regional.
texts.en:
Yovana is in a common-law marriage with a one year old child and works as a social worker. Along with her husband who is a civil engineer, she has a company that provides project management and training to various institutions. Yovana is a partner in the Delfin community bank and needs a loan of 900 soles to help pay for a printer. Yovana's dreams are to see her family thrive, her son properly educated, and her company regionally recognized.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial payment for a printer

loans.name: Gladys Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 23 años de edad y soltera y es natural de L.,  ella estudia administración turística y trabaja en un restaurante de nombre  “antojitos”;  desde hace 8 meses, La socia solicita el préstamo para ahorrar para sus estudios y su alquiler.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Mi Perú (My Peru). The bank is located in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco.

The client is Ms. Gladys. She is 23 years old, single, and is a native of L.. She studies touristic administration and has worked in a restaurant called Antojitos for the past 8 months. She is requesting the loan to save for her studies and her rent.

Gladys is grateful for those who are part of this dream and she promises to make her payments according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To save for her studies and her rent

loans.name: Melina

texts.es:
Melina es soltera y vive con sus padres, estudia Ingeniería Química en la Universidad Nacional, Melina tiene 2 teléfonos monederos en la tienda de su mama, además Melina realiza trabajos de bisutería en fantasía fina, sus productos los ofrece a los trabajadores de instituciones y también hace pedidos, también hace chocolates para eventos como el día de la madre.
Melina es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín y solicita un crédito de 750 soles para la compra de materiales.
Los sueños de Melina son tener una empresa relacionada a su carrera y tener una tienda de joyas y chocolates.
texts.en:
Melina is single and lives with her parents while she studies chemical engineering at the Universidad Nacional. Melina has 2 pay phones in her mother's store and makes costume jewelry. She sells thes jewelry to employees at various institutions and takes special orders. She also makes chocolates for special events like mother's day. Melina is a partner in the Delfin community bank and is requesting a loan of 750 Soles to buy materials. Melina's dreams are to have a company in a field related to her studies as well as jewelry and chocolate shop.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín. 
Josefina es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Josefina viaja a la selva ayacuchana una vez por semana a donde lleva verduras y de la selva trae frutas que luego comercializa en las ferias y donde compra cereales que procesa para comercializarlos, actividad que realiza con carro propio.
Josefina solicita un crédito de 750 soles para la reparación de su carro.
Los sueños de Josefina son comprar un carro mas grande para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the communal bank Delfín. She lives with her partner and has 2 children in school. Josefina travels to the Ayacuchana jungle once a week where she delivers vegetables and brings back fruit from the jungle to sell in the markets. She also buys grains that she processes to sell. She does this with her own car. Josefina is requesting a loan for 750 soles (Peruvian currency) to repair her car. Her dream is to buy a larger car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs on her car

loans.name: Gladys Rosita

texts.es:
Rosita es conviviente, no tiene hijos y vive en casa alquilada, Rosita tiene una tienda en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Rosita vende salchipollos por las noches en la puerta de su tienda.
Rosita es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín y solicita un crédito de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche.
Los sueños de Rosita son ampliar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosita lives in a rented house with her partner. She doesn't have any children. Rosita has a stO. where she sells groceries, vegetables, meats and drinks every day. In addition, she sells salchipollos (a traditional dish with fried, shredded chicken, fried potatoes and sausage) at night from the door of her stO.. Rosita is a member of the communal bank Delfín and is requesting a loan for 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) to buy rice, sugar and milk. She dreams of expanding her business and building a house.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and milk for her store

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 50 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijas. Hace más de 35 años vende pescado, en donde cada madrugada desde las 3:00am espera al distribuidor de pescados, en el centro de acopio llamado “El Pesquero”, y es ahí donde se instala para vender, donde sus clientes, siendo comerciantes pequeños compran al por mayor para dirigirse a sus puntos de ventas en diversos sitios de la ciudad. Una de sus cualidades como comerciante es que siempre vende al peso exacto. Se siente satisfecha por su negocio que  desempeña; ya que con estas ganancias pudo forjar el taller de costura, donde laboran sus hijos. Sus planes en el futuro, es equiparse con otras maquinas mas sofisticadas, que realicen  buenos acabados en las costura, y con el tiempo pueda dejar la venta de pescado. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. Con el crédito que solicita, incrementará la cantidad de este producto perecible, de esa manera podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isabel is 50 years old and is a hard working mother. She lives in her own home, along with her husband and four daughters. She’s been selling fish for more than 35 years. Every morning at 3:00 AM, she waits for the distributor at the central collection point, known as “El Pesquero” (the fish place). This is also where she sets up to sell, and where her customers, small businessmen, buy in bulk to distribute to their own points of sale within the city. One of her work qualities is that she always sells by exact weight. She is satisfied with her business, and her profits allowed her to start the tailor shop where her children work. Her future plans are to get new sturdier sewing machines that produce good products and be able to leave behind her fish selling business. This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. She will use the money from this loan to buy larger amounts of her perishable product, in order to meet her customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish

loans.name: Elsa Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elsa; ella tiene 69 años de edad y es viuda, 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista,  la socia vende comida en el grifo San Jerónimo; desde hace 15 años. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes e insumos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "Mi Peru." The bank is located in the district of Santiago in the province and region of Cusco. Ms. Elsa, 69, is a widow with three children. She works in retail and has sold food at the San Jerónimo gas station for the past 15 years. Elsa requests a loan to buy supplies and ingredients for her business. She expresses gratitude to all those who have formed part of this dream through this medium and she promises to make all her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Denis Julian

texts.es: Denis Julián, tiene 44 años de edad, el se dedica a brindar el servicio de joyería, pues siempre está pensando como un padre responsable y hacer ce cargo de sus hijos y esposa, cuando el inicio era un aprendiz ahora con el paso del tiempo fue que logro tener su propio establecimiento y ofertar la variedad de productos que sabe realizar. Este no es el primer crédito que tiene con Fundación pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con su cuotas. Este financiamiento es para la compra de oro, plata y otras herramientas que son necesarias en su negocio.
texts.en:
Denis Julián is 44 years old. He services jewelry for a living. He is always thinking like a responsible father and takes care of his wife and children. He started as an apprentice and now, after some time, he has established his own business. He offers a variety of products that he knows how to service. This is not his first loan with Fundación. He has shown that he is very responsible with his payments. With this loan he will buy gold, silver and tools that he needs for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gold, silver and tools for his business

loans.name: Teodoro Mateo

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del poblado de Quezalguaque específicamente en la comarca las mercedes, del empalme de quezalguaque 250 vrs al sur,  actualmente está trabajando en el instituto Nacional Forestal de aquí de león, desempeñándose como responsable del departamento de producción desde hace 14 meses, su núcleo familiar son sus 2 hijos y su esposa, la cual tiene una pulpería como otro medio de ingreso para mejorar su nivel de vida, sus hijos estudian en el colegio de la misma localidad, el financiamiento va dirigido para seguir  mejorando sus condiciones habitacionales que le permita mejorar las condiciones atraves de su salario el pago de sus obligaciones sin afectar los de la pulpería. Además ya tiene 4 créditos con nuestra empresa los que le han mejorado sus expectativas de desarrollo.
texts.en:
This client is from the village of Quezalguaque in the Las Mercedes region. He currently works at the National Forestry Institute in León, serving as the head of the production department for the past 14 months. His family includes two children and his wife, who has a small grocery store as another means of income to improve their standard of living. Their children are in school in the same town.

The loan will be used to further improve their living conditions through his wages without affecting his wife's store. He also has four loans through his company that are also improving their development prospects.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials for their home

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Norma; ella tiene 59 años de edad y es casada tiene 5 hijos y se dedica  a la administración de su tienda abarrotes, ella tiene una pequeña tienda, La socia necesita el préstamo para implementar su negocio con la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideos, aceite. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la mercadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Mi Peru” communal bank, located in the Santiago district of the Cusco department. Norma is 59 years old, married, and has five children. She runs a small grocery store and needs a loan to buy sugar, noodles, and cooking oil to supply her business. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in merchandise. She is grateful to those who participate in this dream through this medium and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
Deyby C. C. tiene 54 años(la señora que viste pantalon rojo y chompa guinda)ejerce el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía “Siempre Adelante” una mujer emprendedora madre D. 2 hijos por los cuales lucha día a día por salir a delante y darles una mejor calidad  D. vida  y una educación basada  en principios y valores La alcancía  esta formada por 9 entusiastas y comprometidas socias y un socio ellos vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD hace 18 meses, 
En la actualidad Deyby  tiene dos negocios un locutorio el cual lleva el nombre D.  “Divino  Niño Jesús” que lleva un año trabajando en este negocio y también se dedica a la venta D. comida en la casa D. sus  padres donD. vive y desD. ahí  distribuye   almuerzos a clientes fijos  que tiene en fabricas y las personas que quieran degustar su  exquisita sazón en la casa donD. las prepara.
    Deyby sueña con tener su casa propia  y ve  con mucho optimismo ya que dentro D. muy corto tiempo comprara un terreno gracias a los ahorros  y ganancias que a obtenido D. estos dos negocios porque quiere tener sus dos negocios dentro D. su propia casa.
     El préstamo actual lo usará para capital D. trabajo, por la gran demanda que tiene  negocio D. llamadas comprando 3 nuevas  cabinas D. locutorio
texts.en:
Deyby C. C. is 54 years old (wearing red pants and a cherry colored sweater in the photograph) is the president of the “Siempre Adelante” (Always Ahead) communal bank. She is a very entrepreneurial mother of two children. She struggles daily to move them ahead, give them a better quality of life, and proviD. them with a basic education in values and principles. The communal bank is maD. up of nine enthusiastic and committed women and one gentleman. They have been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for the past 18 months. Deyby currently has two businesses, one is a call center called “Divino Niño Jesús,” which she has had for one year; she also sells prepared food out of her parent’s home (where she lives). From there she distributes lunches to her steady customers in factories and to people who want to experience the flavor in the home where she prepares them. Deyby dreams of having her own home and is very optimistic that she will be able to buy a piece of land soon, thanks to her savings and the income that she has gotten from her two businesses. She wants to run both businesses out of her own home. She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy three more call booths, because of high customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Call booths

loans.name: Yohny David

texts.es:
Yohny es un padre de familia de 22 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa, sus dos menores hijos y su madre, que es viuda, en el sector Hualtaco, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, en la zona se producen principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y limón, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agicultura, específicamente a la ganadería, el cuenta con cinco cabezas de ganado vacuno que le producen leche de manera diaria, el vende este producto a sus vecinos y a un acopiador de la zona el cual la vende a su vez a una de las empresas procesadoras de lácteos mas grande del país. El alimenta a sus vacas con pastos naturales. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad  los utiliza en el mantenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Yohny desea mejorar la producción de sus vacas adquiriendo alimento balanceado, como no cuenta con el capital suficente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles. Con esta inversion la producción de sus vacas aumentará y percibirá más ganancias.

Yohny es un joven bastante luchador y trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive es bastante conocido y estimado.
texts.en:
Yohny is a father. He is 22 years old and lives with his wife, his 2 youngest children, and his mother who is widowed. They live in Hualtaco, a rural area in the Tambogrande district. In this area they produce fruits such as mango, passion fruit, and lemons, similar to the Piura province which is located in the same region, more than 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. The capital of this region is called Lambayeque. He works in agriculture, more specifically cattle-farming. He has five head of cattle who produce milk on a daily basis. He sells this product to his neighbors and a gatherer of the area, who in turn sells it to one of the largest diary processing companies in the country. He feeds his cows with natural grass. He uses the revenue from this activity to maintain the economy of his family. Yohny wants to improve the production of his cows in acquiring a balanced feed, but he does not have sufficient capital to do so. He has decided to apply for the first time for a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 700 new soles. With this investment the production of his cows will increase and he will receive greater earnings. Yohny is a young fighter and hard worker. His greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businessman to provide his family a better quality of life. In the area where he lives he is well known and liked.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of balanced feeds and improve the feeding of diary cattle.

loans.name: Gina Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gina; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos se dedica al comercio minorista y la socia vende ropa, La socia trae pedidos de la ciudad de Lima y de Juliaca, ella necesita aumentar su mercadería, ya que tiene pedidos de una institución de pantalones y chompas de cuello tortuga. La socia solicita el préstamo para  aumentar  su mercadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Mi Peru” communal bank, located in the Santiago district of the Cusco department. Gina is 28 years old and a single mother with two children. She runs a small clothing business and fills her orders by bringing her merchandise from Lima and Juliaca. She needs to increase her inventory because she has an order for pants and turtle neck sweaters from an institution. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to increase her inventory. She is grateful to those who participate in this dream through this medium and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria Margarita tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es la venta de comida en donde ofrece diversos platillos esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con créditos. Debido a que el sueldo de su esposo es muy poco, ella decidió hace ocho años iniciar su propio negocio, el cual le permitiera contribuir junto a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar, idea que nació con la iniciativa de tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en granos básicos, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, jugos, bolsas y servilletas. Sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita is 52 years old. Her business is in the sale of food, where she offers a diverse variety of dishes. This is not the first time that she applies for a loan. Due to her husband's salary being small, eight year ago she decided to start her own business which would help her along with her husband to contribute to covering the home expenses. This notion was born from the desire to be more financially stable. She is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy basic grains, vegetables, fruit, sodas, juices, bags and napkins. She dreams of enlarging her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 45 años, es una madre de familia muy jovial, es separada y vive en su casa propia, junto a sus 2 hijos que son estudiantes. Por las mañanas trabaja, cuidando ancianos de la tercera edad, cuyo centro laboral que a una hora de su carro de su casa;  sin embargo durante el resto del día se dedica a ofrecer productos nutricionales a sus vecinas y amigos. Los 2 años que lleva en este negocio le han dado la experiencia necesaria, para persuadir a sus clientes, siendo así rentable sus ventas. Le gusta vender en este lugar; ya que la gente se preocupa en prevenir su salud, aunque en tiempos de invierno no consumen mucho estos productos, como en el verano. Espera más adelante incrementar el número de clientes en su cartera, y terminar de construir su casa para que pueda vivir de la rentas. En su décimo crédito con MFP y espera pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, siendo la líder de su grupo se compromete en seguir trabajando responsablemente. Con el crédito que solicita, incrementará sus productos nutricionales, para seguir atendiendo los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Julia is 45 years old and a jovial mother. She is separated and lives in a home of her own, along with her two children, who attend school. In the mornings she works caring for senior citizens at the work center, located an hour from her home by car. She spends the rest of the day selling nutritional products to her neighbors and acquaintances. Her two years in this business have given her the necessary experience for persuading her customers, so her sales are profitable. She likes to sell from this location, because people are concerned with preserving their health, although they don’t consume as many of these products during the winter months as during the summer. She expects to increase her customer base and finish building her house so that she can live off of the rent. This will be her tenth loan through MFP and she expects to make all of her payments on time. As her group’s leader, she is committed to working responsibly. She will use the money from this loan to increase her inventory of nutritional products so that she can fill pending customer orders.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es madre soltera, tiene 43 años de edad y vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa de un tío de avazada edad en el caserío La Capilla Central de Ñaupe, distrito de Olmos, ubicado dos horas quince minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años es propietaria de una pequeña bodega que funciona en su casa. Allí vende productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite). Este negocio es bastante importante para sus vecinos ya que la zona en donde viven se encuentra alejada del pueblo mas cercano y muchas veces no tienen acceso fácil a productos de consumo diario. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad se encarga de solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

Sabina se esmera mucho por ofrecerle a sus clientes una buena atención, siempre trata de brindarles productos de calidad y una buena atención a sus clientes. Su negocio ha ido creciendo con el tiempo y ahora ella necesita adquirir mas productos para satiafacer la demanda de sus clientes, por este motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Sabina ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y con el Fondo Kiva. Con el préstamo anterior pudo comprar algunos productos que le permitieron mantener su negocio y darle un nuevo impulso. Ella trabaja diariamente siguiendo su deseo de ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Sabina is a single mother, 43 years old, and lives with her 3 children in the house of an uncle of advanced age in the settlement of La Capilla Central de Naupe. This is located in Olmos district, 2 hours 15 minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. Since 3 years ago, she has been the proprietor of a small grocery store that functions in her house. Here she sells products of primary necessity (rice, sugar, cooking oil). The business is sufficiently important for her neighbors, since the zone where she lives is located outside the nearest town and often they don't have daily access to consumer products. With the income she receives from this activity she is able to cover her family's expenses. Sabina endeavors to offer her customers good service, always trying to provide quality products and attentive service to her clients. Her business has been growing over time and now, she needs to acquire more products to satisfy customer demand. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 new sols. Sabina has previously worked with our Institution and with the Kiva fund. With her last loan she bought products that helped maintain her business and gave it a new impulse. She works daily, following her desire to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRODUCTS OF PRIMARY NECESSITY AND GROCERIES TO EXPAND THE GENERAL STORE INSTALLED IN HER HOME

location.town: Capilla Central de Ñaupe - Olmos - Lambayeque

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es: La señora Gissela a sus 36 años viven en la zona D. Hijos D. Apurimac , está casada, tiene 3 hijos y  comenzó vendiendo comidas hasta que se compro un mototaxi con el cual hace transporte y sostiene su casa junto a su esposo el cual trabaja D. chofer D. carga pesada, además D. los alimentos también costean los estudios del Instituto D.  Mecánica donD. estudia su hijo. Lleva 4 años trabajando con Edaprospo y 2 reuniéndose como presidenta del grupo “Los Capullitos” nombre que sugiere el inicio D. algo grandioso, el grupo es conformado por 11 madres y espera pronto comprarse un auto para hacer taxi, con el cual espera ayudar más a su familia.
texts.en:
Gissela is 36 years old, is married, has three children, and lives in the “Hijos D. Apurimac” zone. She began selling prepared food and later bought a moto-taxi, with which she provides transportation services and her husband, who is a heavy freight truck driver, support their household. Besides food, they also pay tuition to the Mechanical Institute, where their son studies. She’s been working with Edaprosporo for four years and is the president of her group, “Los Capullitos” (The Little Coocoons), a name that signifies the beginning of something grand. The group is maD. up of 11 mothers and she expects to be able to buy a car that she will convert into a taxi soon. She expects to be able to proviD. more help to her family this way.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 60 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto  a su esposo y sus 2 hijas mayores. En un inicio se dedica a vender ropa, con el tiempo instaló una bodega en el interior de su domicilio, aunque pensó dejar el comercio de venta de ropa, no lo pudo concretar debido a la demanda que le hacen sus clientes. Hoy en día no solo vende ropas, sino edredones, cubrecamas, sabanas y demás artículos para el hogar. Le gusta todo tipo de comercio y le va muy bien; ya que ambos negocios son rentables, pero donde se siente mucho mejor es la venta de ropa, por ello no desaprovecha la minima oportunidad en entregar sus pedidos; mientras su hija atiende su bodega. En adelante desea ampliar su negocio, también quiere dedicarse a la  venta de comida. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, como lo viene haciendo como hasta hoy en día. Con el crédito que solicita, va incrementar prendas casuales para damas, asimismo comprará mercaderías para el incremento de su bodega, de ese modo surtirlos con productos variados.
texts.en:
Julia is a 60 year old hard working mother who lives in her own home with her husband and two young daughters. She began selling clothing and eventually opened a store within her home. She was going to end her clothing business, but decided to keep it because she had so many customer requests. Today she not only sells clothing, but also down comforters, sheets, and other articles for the home. She likes all kinds of business activities and she is doing well. Both of her businesses are profitable, but she likes her clothing business the most and she doesn’t waste any time delivering her orders, while her daughter attends to the store. She wants to expand her business in the future and also wants to start selling food. This will be her tenth loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time, as she has been doing up to now. She will use the money from this loan to buy casual ladies’ clothing and other merchandise for her store, in order to have a wider assortment of products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en: Wennie L. is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general-store business. She lives in Sitio Kabangkalan, Brgy. Daan Lungsod, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general-store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Wennie is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she could use it as additional working capital. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Wennie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dunhhanon(a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma C. lives in Brgy. Talangnan, Madredijos, Cebu City. She is marred to Jershon Alfonso C. III, 35 years old, and they have six children, ages 2- 12. Emma has three businesses: a chicken barbecue business, a dried locust business, and a fishing business. Her husband works in the chicken barbecue field and helps his wife with her business activities. Emma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 cycle loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 30,000, and uplifted the family's standard of living. Emma's 14th cycle loan of PHP 28,000 will be used to buy a new pump boat for her fishing business. With her earnings, she will continue to save for the future, provide good education for her children and to improve their living conditions. Emma C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.
