loans.name: Julia Balbina

texts.es:
La Señora. Julia Balvina A. es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre  en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por su la belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, los jóvenes salen a la ciudad en busca de un mejores oportunidadades de trabajo y muchos han migrado a diferentes partes del mundo para mejorar la economía de sus hogares.

Doña Julia tiene 61 años, es divorciada hace 25 años y tiene 3 hijos, todos son mayores de edad y casados; Doña Julia vive en compania de 12 nietos, 6 son de una hija que vive fuera del país y los 6 son de otra hija quien vive en su casa, gracias a su sacrificio y trabajo diario ha logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Julia para mejorar la economía de su hogar se dedica a la cría de pollos, es negociante de chanchos y también se dedica a la venta de hortalizas y granos tiernos los días miércoles y sábados en la feria libre.

Es nuestra socia hace ocho años y medio,  los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su negocio, el nuevo crédito que realiza en la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y también en víveres para reiniciar con su tienda la que ha cerrado por falta de capital,  su meta es sacar adelante su tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Balvina A. is a member of the Los Talvos communal bank. She lives in a community of the same name located in Valle parish, a parish knows for its natural beauty. Its residents are mostly farmers and cattlemen. The young people leave and go to the city in search of better employment opportunities. Many have emigrated to various parts of the world looking for better economic conditions for their homes. Julia, 61, was divorced 25 years ago. She has three adult, married children. She lives with 12 of her grandchildren six of whom are children of one of her daughter who lives abroad and six of another daughter who also lives with her. Thanks to her sacrifice and daily work she has managed to build her own house. To improve her home’s economy she raises chickens. She also is a pig merchant. On Wednesdays and Saturdays she sells vegetables and tender grains in the farmer’s market. She has been our partner for eight and a half years. The loans have been of great use to her business. The new loan she is negotiating with the Fundación will be used to buy pigs and groceries in order to reopen her store that has been closed due to lack of capital. Her goal is for her store to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and groceries.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian T. lives in Prk. Bugnay, Brgy.Vista alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She is a 61-year old married woman who operates three business ventures: she buys and sells Nipa (a palm whose foliage is used for thatching, basketry, etc.), and she also operates a food-vending business and a rice-trading business. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and by working hard. Her efforts are gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP10000. Lilian's 8th cycle loan of PHP29500 will be used to buy nipa leaves and rice. Her previous loan of 24000, which she paid off well within its term was another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lilian aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 which she intends to use to buy more fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and education of her children. Melba B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Carpo

texts.en:
Carpo T. is from the town of Talibon. He is 45 years old and married with seven school-aged children. To make a living, Carpo owns and operates a business venture providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income is primarily from hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members.

Carpo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Carpo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Carpo is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to expand his business. This will be Carpo's seventh loan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support his family.

loans.use: To expand the business

texts.en:
Adelfa S. is a widow who lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures, a general store and making snare structures for crabs. Adelfa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1990 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 23 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Adelfa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 24th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general (sari-sari) store so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children. Adelfa S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora Ana María T. es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por su la belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, los jóvenes salen a la ciudad en busca de un mejores oportunidades de trabajo y muchos han migrado a diferentes partes del mundo para mejorar la economía de su hogar.
 
Doña Ana María tiene de 62 años, es viuda hace 10 años y  tiene 10 hijos todos mayores de edad,  8 de ellos son casados y viven  independientemente, sus dos hijos solteros viven en su casa, ellos trabajan y estudian por la noche; Gracias a su trabajo tiene  casa propia.

La Señora. Ana María se dedica a la cría de animales, actividad que la realiza hace varios años, cría chanchos y vacas, la leche que obtiene de ellas la vende en su comunidad, también tiene una pequeña tienda en la que labora de 9 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 12 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de más chanchos y  víveres para su tienda. Su meta es crecer en su negocio de animales.
texts.en:
Ana Maria T. is a member of the communal bank "Los Talvos." She lives in the community of San Miguel in the del Valle parish. This parish is known for its natural beauty, and its people work in agriculture and livestock production. The youths leave the city to look for better work opportunities; many have migrated to different parts of the world to improve the economic situation of their families. Ana Maria, 62, has been a widow for 10 years. She has 10 grown children, 8 of whom are married and live independently. Her two single children live in her house; they work and study at night. Thanks to her job she has her own house. Ana Maria raises animals, an activity that she has been doing for a number of years. She raises pigs and cows, and she sells the milk that she gets from them in her community. In addition, she has a small store where she works from 9am until 6pm. Ana Maria has been a member of the communal bank for 12 years; she will use her new loan to buy more pigs and to buy groceries for her store. Her goal is to make her business selling animals grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and also groceries for her store

Marcial E. is from the town of Talibon. He is 40 years old, married and has two school-aged children. loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Mariana de Jesús García es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por su la belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, los jóvenes salen a la ciudad en busca de un mejores oportunidades de trabajo y muchos han migrado a diferentes partes del mundo para mejorar la economía de sus hogares.
 
La Señora Mariana trabaja como ayudante de secretaria hace 9 meses,  labora de 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. de lunes a sábados, en su hogar se dedica a la cría de animales como: chanchos, pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en la feria de ganado.

Doña Mariana tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 3 años de edad, su esposo es de profesión albañil,  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa prestada de un familiar.

Es nuestra socia hace 5 años y los créditos que le han otorgado le han beneficiado para la compra de animales y para llevara víveres a su hogar. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más chanchos para crecer en su negocio.

Su meta es  ponerse unas cabinas telefónicas e Internet por su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariana de Jesús García is a member of the Los Talvos communal bank. She lives in San Miguel, a community in Del Valle parish, known for its natural beauty. Its residents are farmers and cattlemen. The young people move to the city in search of better employment opportunities and many have emigrated to various parts of the world in an effort to improve their home’s economies. Mariana has worked as a secretarial assistant for the last 9 months. She works from 8am until 5pm, Monday through Saturday. At home, she raises small farm animals like: pigs, chickens and guinea pigs that she then sells at the livestock fairs. Mariana, 24, is married and has two children who are 4 and 3 years of age. Her husband is a bricklayer. They do not own their own home; they live in a house they borrow from a relative. She has been our partner for 5 years and the loans she has been granted have been beneficial in the purchase of animals and to provide groceries for the home. She will use the new loan to buy more pigs in order to enlarge her business. Her goal is to install phone and Internet service booths for her community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa D. is a 55-year-old widow who lives with her two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her two daughters live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter is a teacher while the youngest one is a student. 

Tsetsegmaa operates a clothing business specializing in hats retailing from a rented stall at the local market. She started her business in 2001 and since then has found success in her trade and has used her earnings to support her family and pay her daughter's tuition fees.  In the future, Tsetsegmaa hopes to continue her success and grow her business. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Sokhary's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of twenty-eight members, located in Ta Reab DoU. Sa village, Kandal province. Mrs. Sokhary N., age 27, is the village bank president, having selected by its members. With their loan, each member of this village bank hopes to increase his or her income to improve the living conditions of their family.

Mrs. Sokhary N. is a beautician in the local village while her husband, Mr. Kimheang L., is a laborer. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase income to improve the family's condition, Mrs. Sokhary N. will use the loan that she has requested from AMK to buy clothes for her new business. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her new business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 25 years old, married and has two infant children. To make a living, Jacqueline owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Jacqueline has been engaged in her business for over three years.

Jacqueline joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan that Jacqueline has taken out from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris M. is from the village of Mialen Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Iris is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Iris owns & operates a motor transport "habal-habal" services business. Iris has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Iris joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Iris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Iris is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair the existing engine. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Iris from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the existing engine.

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Pra Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen members make up this village bank loan and they live in Prey Slaeng village in Takeo province. Mrs. Ny P., who was born in 1977, is the village bank president, having been selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Ny P. and her husband, Mr. Kam Sort Yun, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) plot of land that they use to cultivate rice, not to sell but to support their family. Mr. Kam Sort Yun is also a construction worker.

Mrs. Ny P.’s problem is that her field has infertile soil but she does not have enough money to support it. So, to improve her production rice, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer.

Mrs. Ny P. is the mother of five children, one of whom is a construction worker, another three are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is only a year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar B. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. His wife has a hearing problem and receives a handicapped allowance. However, she runs a small food shop in their yard and she also sews traditional clothes at her home. They have been living at their current address for three years.

Erdenebaatar started a transportation business in 2007. Since 2009 he has been operating a meat retailing business in his local town. His household's consumption depends on his business earnings only, so he has to work very hard. He purchases livestock at wholesale prices from the neighbor sub-provinces two or three times a month in order to slaughter and resell to make more profit. Since he has been operating a meat retailing business, he is able to create permanent customers and has gained much experience

Erdenebaatar is a hard working person who says "Meat trading seems to be a very profitable business. I am planning to purchase more livestock in order to resell in the coming spring at higher prices."  Erdenebaatar is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large number of livestock and sell out at retail prices.

loans.use: To purchase a large number of livestock

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia T. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 59 years old, married and has 10 adult-aged children. Eufemia owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling bamboo products such as "banig" and "dingding" (floor and wall mats) to local businesses and community members. Eufemia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Eufemia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eufemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Eufemia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Eufemia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Pablo Cesar

texts.es:
Pablo Cesar es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Las Pampas del distrito de Olmos, un distrito agrícola conformado por un pueblo central y varios caseríos, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura: se dedica a la comercialización de ganado ovino y caprino, el adquiere ovejas y cabras a los ganaderos de zonas aledañas, las engorda y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente tiene instalado un cultivo de maíz en una pequeña extensión de terreno. Con estas dos actividades el se encarga de solventar los gastos familiares por lo que se esfuerza al máximo para mantenerse en el negocio.

Pablo Cesar desea adquirir mas ovejas para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta, además desea realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para así poder obtener las ganancias que le permitan realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda. Pablo es una persona bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos le consideran alguien tranquilo y confiable.
texts.en:
Pablo Cesar is a 37 year old father who lives with his wife and children in the Las Pampas sector of the Olmos district, a farming district with a central town and various farmhouses. It belongs to the Lambayeque province and is located about two hours from the city of Chiclayo. He works at various farming related tasks. He sells sheep and goats. He acquires the sheep and goats in the neighboring areas, fattens them up and when they reach a good development level he puts them up for sale to the traders that come to the area where he lives. Also, he grows corn on a small plot of land. With these two activities he covers the expenses of his family, and that is why he works very hard to stay in business. Pablo Cesar wants to get more sheep to expand his business of raising and selling them, and also wants to make some improvements in his pens. In order to accomplish this he has come to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a loan of 1000 New Soles. His greatest desire is to continue growing as a businessman and in this way be able to obtain more income that will allow him to make improvements to the infrastructure of his home. Pablo is a hard working person and dedicated to his family. The neighbors in the area where he lives consider him as a quiet and dependable person.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep to expand the business of raising and selling.

loans.name: Mariel

texts.en:
Mariel T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 28 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. She has a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. She works hard to sustain her family, and especially to pay for her children's education.

Mariel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a  loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This will be her 1st loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.name: Mrs. Kan Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan S., 38, is the president selected by the 12 members of this village bank loan in Prey Slaeng village in Takeo province. All members will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their lives.

Mrs. Kan S. and her husband, Mr. Sam Art En, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow rice to feed their family. Mr. Sam Art En is also a construction worker. Mrs. Kan S.'s rice field is infertile. To improve production, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire farm laborers to grow rice. She is the mother of seven children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory, four are studying in school and the youngest one is 1 year old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to hire farm laborers to grow rice

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:

Evelyn owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables such as "kalamongay", "likway" and "alogbati" for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used for additional capital for her business. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Bayarmunh

texts.en: Bayarmunh D. lives with his wife in their own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He runs his business with the help of his wife. Their living standard is normal. He sells small construction auxiliary materials as well as cellphone units in Jobi Trade Center - one of the biggest construction markets, which is located at the city center.  His business daily income ranges from about $80 to $95 and his working capital reaches approximately 2,300,000 MNT. He is very experienced in this field. He plans to expand his business operation further.  Bayarmunh is requesting a 1,050,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To buy more construction auxiliary materials

texts.en:
Celsa T., photographed here with one of her kids, is from the town of Talibon. She is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. She makes charcoal for a living, and has been involved in this activity for more than five years now. Her husband delivers the charcoal to their customers nearby and also to other islands. Celsa is hoping her business will grow. She also hopes to sell fruits and vegetables.

Celsa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celsa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase wood for making charcoal. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Buyantsogt

texts.en:
Buyantsogt M. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Tuv province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His elder son is a student, the middle daughter attends a local secondary school, and his wife is a cattle breeder in their province. 

Buyantsogt graduated from a local vocational training center in 1987 and began his private business in 1990. He operates a dairy products and cattle breeding business with the help of his wife. He says, “I want to continue to pay the tuition fees for my elder child, and I want all my children to be educated young adults with a great passion and enthusiasm for life. My wife and I are planning to increase our business of transferring livestock pasturing into more intensive farming”. 

Buyantsogt is planning on expanding his business in order to increase the quality of his life as well as purchasing an apartment for his elder son. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to pay his son's tuition fee.

loans.use: To afford his son's tuition fee.

Mr. Sareth K. and his wife, Mrs. Srey Sum, are farmers who own a three-hectare (7.5-acre) plot of land that they use to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Mr. Sareth K. is also a vice village chief and his wife is a farm laborer.

Mr. Sareth K.’s problem is that his field has infertile soil. So, to improve his rice production, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer.

Mr. Sareth K. is the father of two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is studying in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer
